loan.name: Consuelo

texts.en: Consuelo is separated from her husband, and has 5 children. She is 43 years old and lives in La Esperanza, Rizal. Consuelo sells bread to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase raw ingredients to make a product to sell. Consuelo has been a member of PMPC for less than a year.

loan.use: To purchase 10 sacks of flour and other ingredients for bread-making

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 37, is a single mother of two children, aged 10 and 12 years. She has been a dairy farmer for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes.7,000.
This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to purchase napier grass, a milking can and a bicycle for transporting the milk. Mary hopes to grow into a large scale dairy farmer in the future.

loan.use: To buy napier grass, milking can, bicycle

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, aged 59, is a single mother of three children. She owns rental houses that have been giving her a monthly income of Kes.5,500 for three years.
This is her second loan with KADET and she has successfully repaid the previous loan. She will use the funds to renovate the houses and paint them. Elizabeth hopes to build more houses in future.

loan.use: To renovate houses and buy paint

loan.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Liza has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, blouses and sweaters. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of used clothing.
Liza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loan.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married and has three school-aged children. Nora and her husband do fishing to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 7000 to purchase a new set of fishing nets for their business.
Nora has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, Nora would like to maintain capital for her business and be able to allocate savings for her children to study in college.

loan.use: To purchase a new set of fishing nets for fishing business

loan.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah, aged 52, is married to Fredrick and they are blessed with three children. Rodah has operated a retail shop for six years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 15,600.
This is Rodah's third loan with KADET and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and soda for sale. Rodah intends to use the anticipated profits from this loan to pay school fees. She hopes to open a hotel in the future.

loan.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and soda

loan.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is married and has two children. He buys and sells pigs. Gilbert has been in this business for six years and is successful in it. He started the business with two pigs and gradually expanded the business. At this time, he has five heads. He wants to receive a loan in the amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs. He is thanking everyone in advance for your support and help. Thank you very much.

loan.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loan.name: Sierra Lee

texts.en:
Sierra Lee is 27 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor Province. She is a single mother of two children. Sierra Lee raises pigs for a living, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,500. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to use as capital for her business.

Sierra Lee has been a member of Pagalaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months. In the future, Sierra Lee hopes to have savings for her two children's future education.

loan.use: To purchase feeds, medicines and farm supplies

loan.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 43 years old and single. He lives with his parents and younger brother at Liwan Sur. He established a food stall to provide sustenance for the family. He cooks food for daily meals and snacks. He is the breadwinner of the family.
He wants to borrow PHP 8,000 to buy ingredients such as onions, garlic, cooking oil, and vegetables to use for his food stall.
He plans to diversify and strengthen his business, and to make more profit from it to help lift his family from their current living conditions.

loan.use: to buy ingredients such as onions, garlic, cooking oil, and vegetables to use in his food stall.

loan.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking and patient mother. She is 57 years old and has sent all three of her children to school. They are now living separately from her. Through the income from her retail business, she provided their allowances when they were still completing their studies.
Lilia still generates income from her business and would like to keep improving it, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, and vegetables to sell. She promise to pay her loan on time and use it well for further development of her business.

loan.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, and vegetables to sell.

loan.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
At the age of 20, Jenelyn is married and has one infant child. She is married to a jeepney driver. She wanted to add to her husband's income, so she established a small store inside her house.
She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy sardines, instant noodles, soap, and detergent to sell in her retail store. She would like to stock more grocery items in her store so that she can meet all her customers' demands; for example, they might need a sachet of shampoo.
In the future, she hopes to construct a more convenient store.

loan.use: to buy sardines, instant noodles, soap, and detergent to sell in her retail store.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 46, is a single mother of one child, aged 22 years. She has been a dairy farmer for thirteen years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 8,300.
This is Mary's first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy cattle feeds, hay and tick spray. Mary hopes to be a large scale dairy farmer in the future.

loan.use: To buy cattle feeds, tick spray and hay

loan.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is an entrepreneur who raises hogs to fatten and breed. She has been in this business for almost a year now. She is 31 years old and has one child.
She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines to ensure the proper growth and nutrition of her hogs. In this manner, she can sell the pigs at a higher price.
Someday, she hopes to earn a good income to provide a good education for her child.

loan.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines.

loan.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is 45 years old, married, and has 2 sons. Both of her sons are young and illiterate. They are butchers and sell chicken meat. Her husband also sells chicken meat. He is 53 years of age and has been operating his business for the past many years. He is very fair in his rates and deals with his customers in a professional manner.
Perveen is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husbands business. With the loan investment, he will buy chickens in larger numbers that will allow him to fill larger orders on time and increase his profits. The wedding season is going on and Perveen is confident that an investment will help her husband make his business more profitable.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loan.use: To buy chickens for her family's meat-selling business.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 31 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She has run a business selling tea in Kator, South Sudan, for three years. Mary is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee for resale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for resale.

loan.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet, 32 years old, is married to Joseph and they are blessed with three children. Violet has operated a retail shop for three years. The business gives her a monthly income of KES 7,900.
This is Violet's first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and soap for sale. Violet hopes to start a supermarket in the future.

loan.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and soap

loan.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Wayan and the other members of the Anyar Sari 2 group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families incomes. Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Wayan hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but also training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs. Ni Wayan will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing her husband's income as a farmer. Ultimately, Ni Wayan hopes that her increased income will enable her to pay school fees.

loan.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed.

loan.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jenifer has a food store, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Jenifer has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Pok

texts.en: Pok, 44, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Pok and her husband sell palm sugar and palm products. Pok is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase more palm sugar to resell at the market. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Pok would like to use any additional income to purchase a plot of farmland and raise livestock. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loan.use: to buy palm sugar and palm products to resell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loan.name: Bette

texts.en:
Bette, 27 years old, is married to Jared. They are blessed with one child who is three years old. Bette sells clothes and has been doing this for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes.6,000.
This is her first loan term with KADET. She will use the funds to buy more clothes for sale. Bette hopes to open a boutique in future.

loan.use: To buy clothes

loan.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 54 years old and lives in D'Ban, Calamba. She is married and has 3 children. Aurora has a grocery store business and earns approximately PHP 6500 each month doing this type of work.
She has requested a loan of PHP20,000 to purchase 10 cases of soft drinks and 20 boxes of grocery items. Aurora has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loan.use: To purchase 10 cases of soft drinks and 20 boxes of grocery items

loan.name: Mariah

texts.en:
Mariah is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
Mariah has had a food shop or "sari-sari" store for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Mariah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loan.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, aged 31 years, is married to Jennifer and is blessed with one child, who is six years old. He sells automobile spare parts.
This is his second loan with KADET, and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. He will use the funds to buy more spare parts for sale. Benson hopes to open a larger hardware store in the future.

loan.use: To buy automobile spare parts

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 29-year-old woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Kator, South Sudan, for two years. Joyce is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread and tomatoes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a structure to house her business.

loan.use: to purchase bread and tomatoes to sell.

loan.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson, 29, is married to Karen. They are blessed with one five-year-old child. Johnson runs a retail shop that has been in operation for four years.
This is his first loan term with KADET. He will use the funds to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, and soap for resale.
Johnson hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loan.use: to buy flour, rice, soap, and cooking oil.

loan.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna, 47, is married and has four children. She resides at Dinas Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Johna is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business.
She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to repair her existing vehicle for better service. Johna has been a member of GDMPC for two years.
In the future, Johna wants to purchase another transport vehicle to improve her business.

loan.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loan.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 34, is married to Joab and is blessed with two children, ages 10 and 12 years. She sells hand towels and purses. She earns a monthly income of KES 18,000.
This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy hand towels and purses for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay fees for her children.
Alice hopes to open a boutique in the future.

loan.use: to buy hand towels and purses.

loan.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 49 years old, married, and has a 13-year-old child. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.
Veronica runs a small eatery in her town. She cooks viands to sell to her community. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business, where she sells items like canned goods. Veronica also makes wind chimes and other house decorations. Veronica works hard for her family.
Veronica has requested this loan to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables and more items to sell. Veronica hopes her businesses will grow. She hopes to purchase her own car in the future.

loan.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables and more items to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy sugar, rice, milk, vegetables, and fruits.

loan.name: Nikki

texts.en:
Nikki is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Nikki is married and has one school-aged child.
To make a living, Nikki runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. She sells items such as cigarettes, shampoo, and soaps. Nikki has had her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.
Nikki is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, Nikki joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situations. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is responsible for her family. She devotes herself to her hog-raising business. Her husband works as a farmer in the village. They both work hard to support their children's needs. Candelaria said that she will do everything to lift her family out of poverty, and that is why she is also engaged in buying and selling fish in the village. Candelaria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vitamins to sustain her hogs and to buy different kinds of fish to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she has requested to further develop her business.

loan.use: to purchase feed and vitamins to sustain her hogs and to buy different kinds of fish to sell.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 49 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two children. Josephine works in the fish industry, catching and selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fresh fish to sell. Josephine became a member of PMPC in 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loan.name: Met

texts.en: Met, 46, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows agricultural crops to financially support her family. Her husband is a fisherman. Additionally, he is a construction worker. Three of her children are employed at a garment factory. Met is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase an agricultural machine to use in her farming business. She can use this machine to till her land, as well as transport her crop to sell. In the future, she plans to grow more rice in the dry season to generate more income to support her family. In addition, she would like to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loan.use: to purchase an agricultural machine to use in her farming business

loan.name: Vahob

texts.en: Vahob is a resident of the region Shahrituz. He is 41 years old. He is married and has two children. His children have gone to work in the Russian Federation. Vahob himself works with growing vegetables and melons. He has already been engaged in this activity for a year. He takes a loan to purchase land.

loan.use: to purchase land

loan.name: Ajelina

texts.en:
Ajelina is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling foodstuffs in Kator, South Sudan, for three years.
Ajelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase bread to sell.

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, aged 46 years, is married to Ben. They are blessed with one child. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for one year. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes.6,460.
This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour for sale. Susan hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loan.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour

loan.name: Karima's Group

texts.en:
Karima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her sons cosmetics business. With the loan investment, he will buy cosmetics such as nail polishes, creams, and other products in larger quantities, allowing him to offer more variety to his customers and increase his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for many years, and Karima is hopeful about his success after this investment.
Karima is very supportive and helps her family financially by sewing clothes for her local clients. She is also an expert in hand embroidery. Karima has 5 other children who are illiterate and stay at home. Due to financial constraints, she couldnt educate her children.
She has great belief in GOD, and she is confident that the living standard of her family will be improved after the betterment of her sons business.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Karima.

loan.use: to buy nail polishes, creams, and other cosmetic products.

loan.name: Sour

texts.en: Sour, 58, is widowed and resides with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a clay stove producer. She has been working in this field since 1982. Sour is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase flat metal to cover her clay stoves. In the future, she would like to expand her business by hiring more people to produce more stoves to sell.

loan.use: to purchase flat metal to cover her clay stoves

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old and married to Agnes. They have six children.
He has been in the business of carpentry for the last 24 years. He earns a monthly income of Kes 23,000. He is applying for his second loan of Kes 5,000. He paid the previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.
He hopes to use the funds to buy carpentry materials, timber, glue, nails, paints, and varnish. He wants to use the profits to pay for his children's school fees.

loan.use: To buy timber, glue, nails, wood paints and varnish.

loan.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 40 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married and has two school-age children. Delia sells fish in the market everyday to earn a living. She earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work.
She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fresh catches of fish from fishermen and to deliver them to the market. Delia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for six months. In the future, Delia hopes to have savings for the better education of her children.

loan.use: To purchase fresh catches of fish from fishermen and to deliver them to the market

loan.name: Naponi

texts.en: Naponi is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She has been selling tea in Kator, South Sudan, for one year. Naponi is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread, sugar, and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loan.use: to purchase bread, sugar, and coffee to sell.

loan.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
Verna has had a food shop or "sari-sari" for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Verna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy plates, curios, spoons, and jugs

loan.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her eldest sons mobile phone business. With the loan investment, he will purchase different models of mobile phones and accessories to improve his business. He has been operating his business for some time now, and Khalida is hopeful that an investment will help him to become better established.
Khalida is the mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her other children stay at home and do not work. In order to financially support her family, Khalida sews clothes for local clients. Because she is very good at her work and believes in providing quality work to her clients, she receives regular orders every month.
She is very confident that, after investing the loan, her family will have a better standard of living and she will be able to provide a dowry for her elder daughter, who is nearing marriageable age.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loan.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories to sell.

loan.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 6 children.
Elenita has had a food shop or "sari-sari" store for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.
Elenita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en: Maria Rosa is a responsible mother who raises hogs. She has been in this business for almost two years. She is 35 years old and has three children. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed and vaccines to ensure the proper growth and nutrition of her hogs. By improving the health of her hogs, she can sell them at a higher price. Someday, she hopes to earn a good income to provide a good education for her children.

loan.use: to buy feed and vaccines.

loan.name: Wendeza

texts.en:
Wendeza is a 24-year-old married mother of two children, ages four and and one. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter. Wendeza makes nipa roofing materials to sell, and also buys and sells dried fish and salted sea oysters, earning an income of 2200 PHP per month.

Wendeza is requesting this loan to buy more nipa and dried fish to sell. She hopes to have a progressive business and also hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loan.use: to buy more nipa and dried fish to sell.

loan.name: Woody

texts.en:
Woody is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children.
Woody has provided motorcycle transport or "habal-habal" services for 5 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his business. Woody is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy tools and gasoline for his transport service.

loan.name: Berna Joy

texts.en: Berna Joy is engaged in agriculture. She raises hogs, and her husband cultivates land. Berna Joy would like to further develop her hog-raising business, and to do this, she needs a sufficient financial investment. With the requested loan, Berna Joy plans to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs. Expansion of the farm will help Berna Joy earn more income so she can renovate her house. House renovation will mean improved living conditions for Berna Joy and her parents, who live with her.

loan.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

loan.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children.
Richard has provided motorcycle transport or "habal-habal" services for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the business. Richard is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy tools and gasoline for his transport service.

loan.name: Navdagul

texts.en: Navdagul continues her activity. She takes a loan for the purchase of children's clothing. Currently her eldest daughter is helping her at the sales stand.

loan.use: to purchase children's clothing

loan.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is a conscientious woman focused on her goals. She is a caring wife and a loving mother of two young children. Nasiba runs her own business selling women's clothing at the local city market. She has been doing this for three years. Nasiba would like to obtain a loan in order to expand her business and stock up on winter clothing. She is hoping for your kindness and generosity.

loan.use: to buy winter clothing for her store

loan.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children.
Feliciano has provided motorcycle transport or "habal-habal" services for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his business. Feliciano is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy tools and gasoline for his transport service.

loan.name: Bahijeh

texts.en:
Bahijeh, an 18-year-old Lebanese single woman, lives with her parents and two working siblings. Her father is the family's main source of income, and he is trying his best to be as helpful as he can.

Bahijeh started her home business as a beautician in 2009, and she also does body tattoos. With many loyal customers, she is happy with the business results that she has thus far attained. She is now requesting a loan of $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new equipment for her business, including a chair so that her customers will feel relaxed and she will be able to work better.

In the future, Bahijeh plans to open her own beauty salon.

loan.use: to purchase a chair and other equipment for her business.

loan.name: Ferida

texts.en: Ferida is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom go to school. She been selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for four years. Ferida is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
Gemma has a shop that sells seedlings of trees like gemilina (beech) and mahogany. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the seedlings. Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers for her seedlings.

loan.name: Leonard

texts.en: Forty-nine years old, married to Leah, and the father of three children, Leonard has been in the carpentry business for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 35,000. Having borrowed and repaid five previous loans from KADET LTD., he is now requesting his sixth loan for Kes 10,000 to buy more workshop tools, timber, nails and wood paints.

loan.use: to buy more workshop tools, timber, nails, and wood paints.

loan.name: Lat

texts.en:
Lat is a 46-year-old widow residing with her son in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia.

To earn a living, she works as a rice farmer. Additionally, she runs a grocery store and makes creels to sell. Her son is a construction worker.

Lat is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase oxen to yoke in order to till her farmland. In the future, she would like to purchase more land to grow rice and to build new house.

loan.use: to purchase oxen to yoke to till her farmland

loan.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina has been engaged in hog-raising for three years. She is 43 years old and still single. She lives with her family in the village of Carabatan Grande. Gina is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise. Gina is very grateful to everyone who can help her achieve her dreams with this loan.

loan.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise.

loan.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Teresita has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale. Teresita has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2005. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has run a business selling perfumes in Kator, South Sudan, for one year. Esther is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase perfumes. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a plot of land for her children in the future.

loan.use: to purchase perfumes for resale.

loan.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Analyn has a barber shop that provides haircutting and styling services with her husband as the master barber. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy materials for her barber shop. Analyn is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy materials for her barber shop.

loan.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en: Kaneez is an expert in embroidery and sewing. She loves her work and works full-time in order to financially support her family. Her customers are very happy with the quality of her work and give her regular orders every time. She has given birth to four sons and three daughters. Two of the children study while three work in the hosiery business. Her elder daughter stays at home and helps Kaneez with household tasks. Her eldest son is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his passengers. Kaneez's husband is a scrap dealer and supplies scrap to different factories and other dealers in the city. Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husbands scrap business. With the loan investment, he will buy scrap in bulk to be able to fulfill the needs of his customers and increase his income. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Kaneez is hopeful that his business will become a more profitable one after investment. In the photo, the lady holding the book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Kaneez.

loan.use: to buy scrap in bulk for scrap selling business.

loan.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao is a 58-year-old, single mother of four children living in Kompong Cham province.

She is a local merchant and devotes time to operate a sales business from her home. She sells many types of merchandise, which she buys from her suppliers, often at discounted prices for being a frequent customer.

Currently, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase additional merchandise so that she can increase her sales. With the balance of the loan proceeds, she plans on buying 100 poultries to raising on her yard. Mao hopes to improve her standard of living through the loan form Kiva. She is very appreciative of Kiva's assistance.

loan.use: to increase sales by expanding her inventory of merchandise.

loan.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Cecelia has a retail shop that sells beauty and home products from Personal Collection. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stock from Personal Collection for resale. Cecelia is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stock from Personal Collection for resale.

loan.name: Hauda

texts.en:
Hauda is a 25-year-old Lebanese woman. She is engaged, and she lives with her parents and her one sibling. Her parents pay for all of her family's expenses.

In 2009, Hauda started to work as hair dresser from her home. She has customers from all over the neighboring villages. She explains that her customers are loyal and believe in her beautiful and fashionable style.

Currently, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new cosmetic products, which she feels will increase her job productivity by 30%. In the future, she plans to request more Kiva loans so that she can expand her business and provide even better services.

loan.use: to increase her productivity by purchasing new cosmetic products

loan.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Marivic has a retail shop that sells firewood. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of firewood for resale. Marivic is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of firewood for resale.

loan.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 38-year-old, married man. He and his wife, Esther, have three children.

For the past 11 years, he has been in the dairy business, from which he earns a monthly income of approximately 10,000 KES. He also has a shoe-selling business.

He is applying for his fifth loan through Kiva, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES. He hopes to use the loan proceeds to buy a dairy cow for farming and to boost his shoe-selling business. He explains that he promptly and successfully repaid the previous loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

loan.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to increase shoe sales.

loan.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria is a 55-year-old woman from Malaubang, Ozamiz City, in the Philippines. Elueteria is married and has five adult children.

To earn a living, Elueteria operates a tailoring business. Specifically, she provides general alteration and tailoring services for her local community members. Elueteria has been in this business for over 31 years, and she explains that she typically earns 5,000 PHP per month from the business.

In 2008, Elueteria joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Elueteria is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials for her tailoring business

loan.name: Ongima

texts.en: Ongima is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has run a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for one year. Ongima is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loan.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita owns a retail business in the village where she lives. She has been operating this business for ten years. She started selling small quantities of shampoo, coffee and milk, but now she has increased the range of items in her store. She is proud that with the income earned from the business, she has provided for the daily needs of her children. All three of her children have now earned a degree. Merlita still aims to make improvements in her sales so she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy eggs, canned goods, soft drinks and detergents to sell. She hopes to develop the business so that, someday, it will grow into a mini-grocery store.

loan.use: to buy eggs, canned goods, soft drinks and detergents to sell.

loan.name: Juje

texts.en:
Juje is a 32-year-old man from Maloro, Tangub City. Juje is married and has two children.

To earn a living, Juje owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. Specifically, he provides car repair services for his local community members. Juje has been in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Juje joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, he was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. Juje is now requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and materials so that he can provide additional services for his customers. He plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loan.use: to provide additional services by purchasing repair tools and materials

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 28 year old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food stuff in kator south Sudan for one year. Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loan.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loan.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhum is a humble villager who resides in the Prey Chor district. She is 32 years old and is the loving mother of two children, one of whom is attending a local primary school.

To earn a living, she is completely dedicated to rice farming. She explains that she typically earns approximately of $1.50 per day to support her family.

Chhum is applying for a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase a stock of rice from local farmers at cheap prices to use and eat for the year. Her business goal is to enlarge her farmland and to increase her output as much as she can.

loan.use: to purchase a stock of rice.

loan.name: Zil-E-Huma's Group

texts.en: Zil-e-Huma is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husbands plastic bottle making business. With the loan investment, he will buy raw materials used in making plastic bottles in larger quantities. He supplies these bottles to different shops. Zil-e-Huma is a seamstress and supports her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. Zil-e-Huma is a very confident lady and has a lot of trust in her husband who has been operating his business for many years and has a good number of business contacts. Zil-e-Huma is very sure that he will get more success in his business after making this investment. Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zil-e-Huma."

loan.use: To buy raw materials for her business making and selling plastic bottles.

loan.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 31 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga Dalaga. She is married with three children.
Elvie has a lumber business and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase a chainsaw for her business.
Elvie has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loan.use: To purchase a chainsaw for her lumber business

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loan.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 31-year-old, married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and their one school-age child. He has numerous responsibilities, especially covering his childs education fees.

In 1995, he started his own upholstery business. He is now looking to target and attract more clients.

Currently, he is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more textiles in order to be able to carry on and improve his business activities, which he feels will increase his profits by 15%. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loan.use: to improve and expand his business by purchasing additional textiles

loan.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 49-year-old, married woman. She and her husband, Peter, are blessed to have two children.

To earn a living, she has been operating a salon for the past three years. She notes that her monthly income is approximately 6,500 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan through KADET. She was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET client. Nancy plans on using the loan proceeds to buy a blow dryer for her salon. With the anticipated profits generated by the business as a result of the loan, she would like to expand her business. In the future, she dreams of opening a retail shop.

loan.use: To purchase a blow dryer for her salon

loan.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 43-year-old woman from Liposong, Ozamiz city. Norma is married and has five school-age children.

To earn a living, Norma operates a general store, where she sells everyday products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, to her local community members. Norma has been in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2007, Norma joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's living conditions. Norma is now requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to resell to her customers. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for her family's living expenses.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to resell to customers

loan.name: Hourn

texts.en:
Hourn is a 48-year-old, married woman who resides in Kampong Chnang province.

To earn a living, Hourn raises pigs. Her husband pumps sand to generate income.

Hourn is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase cows to raise and then sale. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Hourn would like to use any additional income from her business to run a small farm on her plot of farmland. This would be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loan.use: to purchase cows to raise and then sell for a profit

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a responsible father who owns and manages a restaurant in a rural community. He is 60 years old and has two adult aged children. Through his patience and sacrifices, he educates his two children and gives them a better life. Despite this, he aims to improve and continue the business in order to be able to earn and save more income to satisfy necessities and save for the future.
He wants to ask for an additional capital of P 50,000 to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasoning to be cooked and sold in his restaurant. He believes that this loan will help him to work out his plan and is hoping that he will be successful in carrying them out.

loan.use: to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasoning to be cooked and sold.

loan.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 29-year-old, single businessman. He explains that he financially supports his siblings.

To earn a living, for the past two years he has been growing trees in nurseries for resale. By doing so, he typically earns a monthly income of approximately 8,500 KES, which he uses to cover his family's living expenses.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET, which would be used to buy seedlings. With the anticipated profits generated from the business as a result of the loan, he will be able to ensure that his siblings receive an education. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of land on which he could plant trees. He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member.

loan.use: To purchasing seedlings

loan.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey, 51, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province where she is a farmer, and her husband sells charcoals. Mey is requesting her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner, for US $1200 to purchase a rice threshing machine for personal use and rental. This will enable her family to generate more income.

In the future, Mey would like to use any additional income to purchase another plot of farmland to produce more rice for sale.

loan.use: to buy a rice threshing machine for personal use and rental.

loan.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married and has two children. She is 39 years old and lives in Lumangcapan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.
Juvy has a business of raising pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 13 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase feed and medicine for raising her pigs in her backyard. Juvy has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for ten months. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase feed and medicine for raising pigs.

loan.name: James

texts.en:
James is 28 years old. He is single, but he supports his family. He has been selling fruit for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after having been introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. James will use the loan to buy more fruit for resale. With the anticipated profit from his business, he will educate his siblings. His hope is to open a retail shop.

loan.use: to buy more fruit for resale.

loan.name: Villamor

texts.en: Villamor is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. Villamor is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline needed in his transportation service. Villamor is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Villamor hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline in his transportation service.

loan.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Myrna has a shop that provides coconut and meat grinding. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to pay for the electricity of the coconut grinder. Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to pay for the electricity of her coconut grinder

loan.name: Bebie Jane

texts.en:
Bebie Jane is a married woman and she has one child. She is 23 years old and resides in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Bebie Jane operates a business raising crops, specifically planting and harvesting mangoes for sale. She has worked in this field for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as baskets and nets. Bebie Jane has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as baskets and nets.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old and a business lady. She is a single mother of one child. She has been selling nursery trees for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. Jane will use the loan to buy seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hope is to buy a piece of land and plant trees.

loan.use: To buy seedlings.

loan.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. Erma has a retail shop that sells beauty and clothing products from NATASHA and AVON . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON for sale. Erma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erma hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON for sale.

loan.name: Sarenn

texts.en:
Sarenn, 30, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. She is a farmer, and her husband buys rice to resell when the price is profitable. Sarenn is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase more rice to resell. Using this loan, her family will be able to generate more income.
In the future, Sarenn would like to use any additional income to purchase a rice threshing machine for personal use and rental. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Sarenn appears in the photograph with her husband.

loan.use: to buy more rice to resell.

loan.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria is a married woman and has seven children. She is 45 years old and resides in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Helaria owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests corn for sale in order to earn a living. She has eight years of experience in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Helaria has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, Helaria wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 46 years old and she is married to Joseph. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a driving school for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 32,000, which she uses to support her family.
Agnes is applying for her first loan with KADET after having been introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to service the driving school lorries. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children. Her hope is to expand her business and open other branches.

loan.use: to service the lorries for her driving school.

loan.name: Venus

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Venus aims to improve her family's status of living and give her children a bright future. She owns and manages a restaurant in the community cooking and selling meals, snacks and souvenir items. She is now 30 years old and has three infant-age children. With her husband, they aim to improve their small restaurant in order to increase their income and satisfy their customers demand.
Due to insufficient capital, Venus is asking for an additional P 50,000 to buy pork, vegetables, fish, seasoning, cup of noodles, soft drinks, coffee and bread to be cooked and sold in their restaurant. She believes that through patience and strong determination they will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loan.use: to buy pork, vegetables, fish, seasoning, cup of noodles, soft drinks, coffee and bread to be cooked and sold in her restaurant.

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 23 years old and a business lady. She is married to Stephen. They do not currently have children. She has been a tailor for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 6,500, which she uses to support her family.
Susan is applying for her first loan with KADET after having been introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to stock up on textile materials. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will support her parents. Her hope is to open her own boutique shop.

loan.use: To stock up on textile materials.

loan.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old and lives in Jimenez. She is married and has two children.
Arlyn has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 25 years. Arlyn has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, and beverages, etc. to stock her store. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods and beverages for her store.

loan.name: Maria Betty

texts.en:
Maria Betty is widowed and has three adult children. She is 50 years old and lives in Looc, Maria, Siquijor.
Maria Betty raises pigs in her backyard to earn a living. She has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs. Maria Betty has been a member of Pagalaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase feeds and medicine for her pigs.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old and a single lady. She has been a tailor for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to cover her basic needs.
Rose is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy textile materials to add to her shop. With the anticipated profit, she will expand her business. Her hope is to open a boutique shop, which will improve her living standards.

loan.use: To stock up on textile materials.

loan.name: Mardy

texts.en: Mardy is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Mardy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Mardy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mardy hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Aramatou

texts.fr: Marie mre de 4 enfants Madame Aramatou est ge de 36 ans et vit dans une famille polygame dans la ville de Koutiala (rgion de Sikasso) avec son mari, sa copouse et leurs enfants. N ayant pas eu la chance de frquenter lcole, Aramatou na pas pris du temps pour embrasser le commerce depuis bas ge, auprs de sa maman. Aprs avoir men plusieurs activits sans russite, elle finit par sorienter vers la vente des tissus et articles divers (chaussures, parures etc) depuis 12 ans. Sa notorit est bonne car elle vend une grande quantit de marchandises dans le mois. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientle en quantit et en qualit, elle dcida de faire recours linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Aprs 6 prts solidaires (prt de groupe) tous pays correctement, elle est son 3 eme prt individuel dont les deux prcdents ont t bien rembours. Avec ce financement elle compte acheter, 10 pices de tissus wax et des paires de chaussures. Elle sapprovisionne Bamako et Bobo (Burkina Faso) et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala une clientle compose de femmes et dhommes, au comptant et crdit. Elle compte raliser un bnfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA quelle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux intrts de Soro, participer aux dpenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans son activit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aramatou, age 36, is married and the mother of four children. She lives in a polygamous family in Koutiala, a city in Sikasso Region, with her husband, his co-spouse, and their children.
Not having had the chance to attend school, she didn't take long to start working with her mother at a very young age. After having tried several businesses without success, she turned to selling fabrics and various other items (shoes, jewelry, etc).
She's been running this business for twelve years, and is now very well-known since she sells large amounts every month.
To satisfy her customers both quantity- and quality-wise, she decided three years ago to seek help from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.
After six solidarity loans (group loans), all repaid without problems, she's seeking her third personal loan. The previous two were repaid without problems.
With this loan, she intends to buy ten pieces of "Wax" fabric and pairs of shoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako and in Bobo (Burkina Faso), and retails in Koutiala, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both women and men.
She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 70'000 (ca US$ 140), to be used to repay Soro Yiriwaso's loan and its interests, and to help with the family daily expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loan.use: to buy 10 pieces of "Wax" fabric and pairs of shoes

loan.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 30 years old. She is married to Peter and they are blessed with one child who is six years old. Emma has been running a spare part business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 6,500, which she uses to support her family.
Emma is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy spare parts to add to her business. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her child. Her hope is to open a wholesale shop.

loan.use: To buy spare parts to add to her business.

loan.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. Marita has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and trout. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell. Marita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell.

loan.name: Nazira

texts.en: For over twenty years, Nazira has been involved in the sale of men's and children's clothes. She's a hardworking woman, married and a mother of four. Her sales spot is located right in the center of the city's main market. Nazira has an abundance of regular customers who are drawn by her excellent quality goods. Nazira's assisted in her work by her sons. She's asking for a loan in order to purchase new goods, expand her business and increase her working capital. Nazira hopes for your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and charity.

loan.use: To buy new assortment of clothes, expand business and increase working capital.

loan.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is married and has five children. She is 54 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin.
Lourdesita raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Lourdesita has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase a cow. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Lourdesita hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase a cow.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more items such as plates and bowls.

loan.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is 41 years old and married to Francis. They are blessed with two children, ages 10 and 7. She has been running a retail shop for the past two years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Philis will use the loan to buy sugar and rice to stock her store. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loan.use: To buy sugar and rice

loan.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, 21 years old, is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as an industrious and committed man. He provides transportation services using his taxi. The business customers are employees in an industrial area and residents. His business faces a challenge of the rising cost of fuel.
He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy home products for a retail kiosk, as he wants to venture into the retail business. In the future, Daniel hopes and dreams to own many more taxis and to operate a bigger shop.

loan.use: To buy home products to start up a new retail business.

loan.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita described herself as a patient and loving woman. With her love for her family, she works hard just to feed her children. She is always praying for the good health of her family and always has a happy family even when there are obstacles they encountered in life. Perlita is 43 years of age, married and blessed with two children who are in school. Perlita manages a rice farming business within her village. Perlita and her husband are working together to give a better way of living for her children. They are preparing for their children's college education. She wishes to see her children become professionals someday. With regards to her business, Perlita is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides to used in the rice farming business. She will do her best to attain her wish.

loan.use: to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides to be used in the rice farming business.

loan.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 49,500 through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell for her frozen products business.
Bella has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from coffee retail.
Bella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loan.use: to buy additional goods to sell.

loan.name: Musyoki John

texts.en:
Musyoki John is 24 years old. He is married and has a two-year-old son.
He has provided transportation services for the last three years in a commercial area. His business faces a problem of inadequate funds to maintain the business. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy another motorbike. Musyoki hopes to own more motorbikes to increase the service in the future.

loan.use: to buy another motorbike.

loan.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 34 years old, married, and has four children.
Chona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a hardware store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional hardware materials to sell.
She has borrowed and paid back twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the hardware store for ten years and also earns an income from fishing.
Chona aspires to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional hardware materials to sell.

loan.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma, 41, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Elma has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables for her business.
Elma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy more vegetables for her business.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old and married to Esther. They are blessed with two children, ages 8 and 4 years respectively. He has been running a stationery shop for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 28,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy a stock of plain papers.
With the anticipated profit from the business, he plans to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will improve the living standard of his family.

loan.use: to buy a stock of plain papers to add to his shop.

loan.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 53 years old and single.
He runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for his business.
Ramon has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from selling rice.
Ramon aspires to save money to expand his business.

loan.use: To buy items to sell for his business.

loan.name: Marysa

texts.en:
Marysa is married and has two children. She is 39 years old and lives in Cabulihan, Larena, Siquijor.
Marysa is a farmer and has a backyard piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase medicine and feed for her business.
Marysa has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase medicine and feed for her piggery business.

loan.name: Sak

texts.en: Sak, 29, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Sak is employed at a garment factory, and her husband is a farmer. Sak is requesting a loan of US $500 to run a grocery store at home. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Sak would like to use any additional income to send children to a good school. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loan.use: to run a grocery store at home.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to increase their second-hand shoes inventory.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40 year old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food stuff in kator south Sudan for five years. Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase bread and ice cream. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loan.use: to purchase bread and ice cream to sell.

loan.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela works hard to support her family. Romela is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.
Romela requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing equipment.
Romela has been in this business for 10 years now.
In the future, Romela would like to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy additional fishing equipment.

loan.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with 9 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 38-years-old and has 6 children who are in school.
Emma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.
Emma has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loan.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. Angelina is married and has a broom-making business in the Philippines.
Angelina requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business.
Angelina has been in this business for 26 years now.
In the future, Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy materials for her business.

loan.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 31-years-old. She is married to Stephen. They are blessed with one child but still assist her siblings. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with the monthly income of Kes 10,000 which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Dorcas will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to add to her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her siblings. Her hopes and dreams are to open a whole sale shop which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to add to her shop.

loan.name: Cherry Lyn

texts.en:
Cherry Lyn is 29-years-old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Cherry Lyn runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell in her grocery store.
Cherry Lyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, liquor, etc.
In the future Cherry Lyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more inventory to sell in her grocery store.

loan.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 41-years-old, and married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Erma has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Erma requested a PHP 16500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.
Erma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Erma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loan.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loan.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 50-years-old and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban. Esterlita is married with 5 children.
Esterlita has a store that sells dried fish. Esterlita has had this business for 5 years. Estelita requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products such as dried fish.
Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional products such as dried fish.

loan.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna Mae works hard to support her family. Anna Mae is married and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines.
Anna Mae requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish business.
Anna Mae has been in this business for 2 years now and also earns additional income from a bakery.
In the future, Anna Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy more fish for her dried fish business.

loan.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Analyn has a pigpen that she uses to grow and sell pigs. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feeds for her pigs. Analyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 47-years-old and is married to Shem. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling tree seedlings for the past six years with a monthly income of Kes 15,000 which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Rose will use the loan to buy seedlings for new trees. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to plant tree seedlings in large amounts.

loan.use: to buy seedlings for new trees.

loan.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is 27-years-old and married with 2 children who are currently going to school. Everlyn works very hard to provide for them.
Everlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.
Everlyn has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, milk, sardines, noodles, etc.
In the future Everlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy items to sell.

loan.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is married with four adult-children. Merlie is 53-years-old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor, Siquijor.
To earn a living, Merlie has a business growing pigs in the backyard. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase feeds, medicines and other farm supplies for her business.
Merlie has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, Merlie hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase feeds and medicines and other farm supplies for piggery business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more items like fuel, some spare parts for the machine and other items.

loan.name: Morn

texts.en: Morn, 51, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Morn and her husband are farmers. Morn is requesting a loan of US $500 to pay for her sons wedding expenses. In the future, Morn would like to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more rice for sale. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loan.use: to pay for her son's wedding expenses.

loan.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 50 years old. She is married to Joseph. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling steel wool for the past eight years with a monthly income of 6,500 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Faith will use the loan to buy more steel wool for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loan.use: To buy more stock of steel wool for her business.

loan.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. Rodrigo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rodrigo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rodrigo hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
Flores Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business.
Flores Marie has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from selling charcoal.
Flores Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loan.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 42 years old and she is married to Samue. They are blessed with three children aged 10, 8, and 5 years respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Stella will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm's produce and improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loan.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of four children. Khawla is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to do home maintenance and she is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: to do home maintenance

loan.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.
Habiba requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.
Habiba has been in this business for 10 years now.
In the future, Habiba would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy materials to repair her fishing boat

loan.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.
She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Helen is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell in her meat vending business.
Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: To buy additional meat to sell

loan.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
Rowena has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Rowena is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Caroline Kaithiori

texts.en: Caroline is a single woman. She has a daughter who is four years old. She describes herself as honest, trustworthy, and innovative. She operates a general store where she provides M-pesa (mobile phone-based money transfer) services, and sells phones and airtime. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located near a tarmac road. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more airtime vouchers and Safaricom cards. Her business goal is to run several similar general stores within five years.

loan.use: To buy more airtime vouchers and Safaricom cards.

loan.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 59 years old, married, and has two children.
