Cristita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.
Cristita has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the variety store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.
Cristita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loan.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 52 years old. He is married to Lucy. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a retail shop for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy stocks of maize flour, rice, and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will help him to improve the living standard of his family.

loan.use: to buy stocks of maize flour, rice, and cooking oil

loan.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a plastic ware retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.
Helen has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional plastic ware to sell.
In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy additional plastic ware to sell.

loan.name: Cuadrita

texts.en:
Cuadrita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
Cuadrita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Cuadrita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Cuadrita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Inda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Inda works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Inda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her transport business.
Inda has been sustaining her business activities through her 17 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loan.name: Eunice Adhiambo

texts.en: Eunice is a widow, and she has three sons ranging from two to fourteen years of age. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She has run a beauty salon where she does plaiting, weaving, and other services for the last ten years. She has three employees. Her business is faced with the problem of low purchasing power among its customers. She will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy hair braids and a blow dryer. In the future, Eunice hopes to run a similar beauty salon in the neighboring town.

loan.use: to buy hair braids and a blow dryer.

loan.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with 2 children.
Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soap, sugar, and groceries to sell.
Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 14 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.
Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: to buy items like soap, sugar, and groceries to sell.

loan.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She is the mother of five children. Mayson decorates with flowers and she is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to purchase flowers for decoration purposes.
Khawla is looking to open a shop to better display her products. She hopes to employ people to help her. She aspires to improve her family's standard of living.

loan.use: to purchase flowers for decoration purposes

loan.name: Camra

texts.en:
Camra is 46 years old, married, and has 6 children.
Camra is in agriculture, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Camra has been farming rice for 10 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 5 times in the past to sustain her business.
In the future, Camra would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loan.name: Jenalin

texts.en:
Jenalin is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children who are in school.
Jenalin is in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Jenalin has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 9 times in the past to sustain her business.
In the future, Jenalin would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loan.name: Naom

texts.en: Naom is 21 years old and single. She describes herself as a determined and focused woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a fast-growing place. She faces the challenge of insufficient funds. She will use the requested KES 10,000 loan to purchase more tomatoes. Her business goal is to run several tomato stores within the next 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more tomatoes.

loan.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is married with 5 children. She is 37 years old and has 2 children who are in school.
Geralyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Geralyn has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy bamboo, binders, and fishing nets.
Geralyn has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy bamboo, binders, and fishing nets.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old and she is a single mother of two children. She has been running a beauty and cosmetic shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Josephine will use the loan to expand into livestock farming through buying pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to have a pig farm which will help her cater for her childrens needs.

loan.use: To buy a pig and pig feed

loan.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.
Loida requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.
Loida has been in this business for 13 years now.
In the future, Loida would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loan.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loan.name: Margaret Kathule

texts.en:
Margaret 68 years old, is married and has six children ranging from 15 to 35 years old. She describes herself as a quiet and idealistic woman.
Margaret runs a green grocery and has been selling kale, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for the last six years. Her business faces a problem of financial constraints when buying the vegetables due to the increasing cost of vegetables. She will use the loan of KES 5,000 to buy potatoes and cabbages. In the future, Margaret hopes to be a supplier of vegetables.

loan.use: To buy potatoes and cabbages.

loan.name: Muhammadi

texts.en: Muhammadi is a driven and well-mannered person. He is married and a loving father of three children. He has been engaged in food sales for over eight years. Previously, Muhammadi worked as a delivery person in the store of his uncle, but eventually started his own business and has been running it successfully since. Muhammadi would like to obtain a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and increase the assortment of products in his store prior to New Year. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loan.use: to buy more food products for his store

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 28-year-old single woman. She describes herself as a good woman.
Margarel operates a retail business where she sells peanuts. She has been involved in this business for the last year. Her primary customers are frequent and new. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased cost of peanuts when buying them wholesale. She will use the loan to buy more peanuts. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loan.use: To buy more peanuts.

loan.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
Lolita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and other seafood to sell in her stall.
Lolita has been in this business for 20 years now.
In the future, Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loan.use: To buy additional fish and other seafood to sell in her stall

loan.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Jonalyn works hard to support her family.
She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.
Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 46 years old, married, and has eight children ranging from twelve to twenty nine years old. She describes herself as a patient woman. She runs a restaurant where she sells food such as cooked rice, chicken, and snacks to frequent and new customers. She has been in this business for the last twenty years and has four employees. Her business faces the problem of storage for the leftovers. She will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy two bundles of maize flour, two bundles of wheat flour, five chickens, a bag of rice, and twenty litres of cooking oil. Mary hopes to run a big hotel [restaurant] in the future.

loan.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, chickens, rice, and cooking oil.

loan.name: Maribelle

texts.en:
Maribelle is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.
Maribelle has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from tricycle transportation.
Maribelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loan.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loan.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.
She has a restaurant in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income by raising pigs. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.
Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to increase her food stock in order to sell more food.

loan.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell.
Marivic has been in this business for 5 years. Marivic earns additional income by raising pigs.
Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loan.use: To buy additional meat to sell

loan.name: Nancy Mwende

texts.en: Nancy is 29 years old, married, and has a four-year-old daughter. She describes herself as a jovial woman. She has run a pharmacy where she sells creams, syrups, tablets, and surgical supplies for the last four years. Her business is faced with the problem of insufficient funds. She will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy syrups and surgical supplies. Nancy's dream and hope is to run a bigger pharmacy retail store.

loan.use: to buy medicines and surgical supplies.

loan.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
Leonila has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Leonila is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Orn

texts.en: Orn, 56, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory. Orn requests a loan of USD 500 to purchase groceries to sell from her home in order to generate more income. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and build a fence and a toilet.

loan.use: to purchase groceries to sell from her home

loan.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 33 years old and married to Mary. They are blessed with one child. He has been running a spare parts shop for the past ten years. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Raphael will use the loan to buy spare parts to add to his business.
With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup and use it for transportation.

loan.use: to buy spare parts to add to his business.

loan.name: Ninalita

texts.en:
Ninalita is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
Ninalita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Ninalita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ninalita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Philip

texts.en: Phillip, 35 years old, is a single man. He has two children, aged five and eleven years. He has been selling cakes and doughnuts for the last two years. His primary customers are residents. His business challenges are insufficient funds and transportation problems while delivering his items. He will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cakes and doughnuts. In the future, Phillip wants to own a bakery shop.

loan.use: to buy more cakes and doughnuts to sell

loan.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old, and she is married with two children, aged 20 and 15 years. She has been rearing rabbits for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Alice will use the loan to buy more rabbits and feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to keep rabbits in a large-scale operation and to introduce chicken-rearing into her business activities.

loan.use: To buy more rabbits and feed

loan.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 43-year-old married woman from Al-Hashmi-Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.
Sana is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do home maintenance.
Sana is looking to improve her family living standards.

loan.use: to do home maintenance

loan.name: Kort

texts.en: Kort, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She sells rice and bran from her home. Her husband is a veterinarian. Kort is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase rice to store in the warehouse in order to sell it when the price is higher. In the future, she would like to purchase rice in large amounts to store and then sell when the price is higher. Moreover, she plans to build a fence around her house and to support her children's education until they get their bachelors degrees.

loan.use: to purchase rice to store in a warehouse in order to sell it when the price is higher

loan.name: Simukai Madzimai Group

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Juliet from Harare, Zimbabwe. She is married and has six children. She also cares for six dependents.
Juliet runs a services business of tailoring table clothes. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge she faces is electricity, which is in short supply.
Juliet has requested a loan of $400 to buy fabric and tailoring materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to help in supporting the family. In the future Juliet plans to own a clothing shop.

loan.use: to buy fabric and tailoring material.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 44 years old, and she is married to Mutunga. They are blessed with three children, aged 18, 16, and 13 years. She has been running a greengrocer business in an open-air market for the past 19 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her sixth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Margaret will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit, she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and to rent a greengrocer house, which will help her to improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more items like rope and spare parts for making beds.

loan.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 31-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.
Ahlam is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family life conditions.
Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is her husband.

loan.use: to do home maintenance

loan.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
Imelda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.
She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Imelda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: San

texts.en: San, 26, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker. Additionally, he is a rice farmer. His wife is a garment worker. San requests a loan of USD 700 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season. In the future, he plans to purchase clothes to resell at the factory and to send his children to a good school.

loan.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season

loan.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 34-year-old divorced woman from Madaba, Jordan.
Ola is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase clothing for trading purposes.
Ola is looking to open a shop for her business so that she can better display her products.
Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Ola's brother.

loan.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loan.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man. He has owned a special tannour bread bakery since January 2011, having had seven years of experience in this field. Tannour bread is made in a clay oven called a tannour. This technique is still being used in some traditional bakeries, just like the one Ali owns, and that's what gives his business a special place among competitors.
Ali is a hard worker, and he works his best to improve his business as much as he can. He plans to make a small happy family in the future, but today all he is looking forward to is expanding his business as much as possible. To do this, he has asked for Kiva partner Al Majmoua's help, requesting a loan in order to buy the necessary flour and diesel for his business at the special price he can get by paying his bills in cash.
Ali is planning to expand the business and to add a special menu to his business.

loan.use: To buy flour and diesel necessary for his business

loan.name: Librado

texts.en:
Librado is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children.
Librado has a tailoring shop that makes and sells office and school uniforms and dresses and repairs shirts. He has had this business for 20 years.
He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.
Librado is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Librado hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loan.name: Seab

texts.en: Seab, 29, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She runs a beauty salon from her home. One of her children is a garment worker. Seab is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a generator to generate electricity for her house as well as her shop. In the future, she would like to purchase cosmetics to sell in her beauty salon, build a concrete house, and send her children to a good school.

loan.use: to purchase an electric generator for her home and business

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 year old a married woman with five children. Three of them are in school.
She has had a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan, for one year.
Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loan.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loan.name: Alphus

texts.en: Alphus is 30 years old and married to Jacinta. They are blessed with two children, aged 5 and 2 years. He has been welding for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Alphus will use the loan to buy metal rails and sheets for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a retail shop.

loan.use: To buy metals for his business

loan.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.
Mary Jane has a tailoring shop that makes and sells office and school uniforms and dresses. She has had this business for nine years.
She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring.
Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy materials needed for tailoring.

loan.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 53 years of age, married and blessed with five children. She and her husband are striving to give the highest level of education to their children since they believe that education is the only treasure they can give.
To make living, Leticia engages herself in farming, which is her family's main source of income. She and her husband plant and harvest rice and sell it in the future. Most of the profit she earns from the business went for their children's fees in school.
Leticia wants to borrow a loan of PHP 27,000 to pay for the labor cost in farming and to buy fertilizers for her rice crop. She will use the loan wisely to earn a higher income from the business.

loan.use: to pay for the labor cost in farming and to buy fertilizers for her rice crop.

loan.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy, aged 28, is married with one child who is five years old. He has been selling charcoal for eight years, which gives him a monthly income of KES 17,000.
This is his second loan with KADET, and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. He will use the funds to buy more charcoal to sell. Kennedy hopes to buy a lorry for transporting the charcoal to a wider customer base in the future.

loan.use: to buy charcoal

loan.name: Joahna

texts.en:
Joahna is a 28-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school.
She has had a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan, for four years.
Joahna is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loan.use: to purchase beans and oil for sale.

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 29, is married with one child who is four years old. He has been a mechanic for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,300.
This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the funds to buy paints and a mechanic's tool box. David intends to use the expected profits to pay school fees for his child and hopes to open a big garage in the future.

loan.use: To buy paints and mechanic's tools

loan.name: Gracious Women Group

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Marvelous from Harare, Zimbabwe. She is widowed with three children, all of whom are attending school. Marvelous runs a childcare service that has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge she faces is a shortage of capital. Marvelous has requested a loan of $400 to buy more furniture, toys, and paintings. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the standard of the daycare center. In the future, Marvelous plans to have a presentable and well-equipped daycare.

loan.use: to buy furniture, toys, and paintings for children to use in lessons.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loan.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 5 children.
Fernando has run a shop for 30 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Fernando is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 47 years-old, is married to Harrison and they are blessed with three children aged between 16 and 24 years. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for 14 years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes. 36,500.
This is her first loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd .She will use the funds to buy stocks of sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil. Mary intends to use the anticipated profits to build more rental houses and hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loan.use: to buy sugar, rice,and flour.

loan.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza lives in the Yavan region. She's twenty-one years old, divorced and has one child. One year ago, Nargiza began a culinary business; she sells various foods from her home. She's asking for a loan so she can increase the variety of the products she sells.

loan.use: to increase her product range.

loan.name: Gene Lou

texts.en:
Gene Lou is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
Gene Lou has had a food shop or "sari-sari" store for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Gene Lou is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Sran

texts.en: Sran, 49, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a tailor. Her husband sells toys in the market. Two of her children are garment workers. Sran is requesting a loan of USD 800 in order to purchase more toys for her husband to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, they would like to build a new house.

loan.use: to purchase more toys to sell.

loan.name: Haleluya Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children who go to school. She has had a pool table business for three years now. She works from 10.00 am to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to modify the area of the pool table place by repairing the floor and the roof which was leaking. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy another pool table and put it in a different area.
She will share this loan with her loan group "Haleluya" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loan.use: to buy another pool table.

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, aged 32 years, is a businessman who runs a spare auto parts shop that has been operating for five years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kes. 90,000.
This is his first loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd. He will use the funds to buy more spare auto parts to sell. Samuel hopes to open another spare auto parts store in the future.

loan.use: to buy spare auto parts.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 24-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, for four years.
Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, aged 31 years, is married to Pauline and is blessed with one child. He sells hardware which gives him a monthly income of Kes.10,000.
This is his first loan with Kiva partner KADET. He will use the loan funds to buy more stock of hardware. Peter hopes to open another hardware shop in the future.

loan.use: to buy hardware to stock.

loan.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en: Bayasgalan is 57 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard and her two kids are unemployed. She started her construction material retail business in 2000 by renting a counter in a market. Her business location is good and stable. Over the years, she has gained many trusted suppliers and customers. Since her income is the main income in the family, she has to work hard in order to support them. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more construction supplies. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says, "My income is not enough to support my family. I have to do something."

loan.use: to buy more construction supplies

loan.name: Easther Christy

texts.en:
Easther Christy is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
Easther Christy has had a food shop or "sari-sari" store for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.
Easther Christy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy a hair drier, hair relaxer, hair oils, and shaving machines

loan.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme g(e) de 43 ans. Elle est marie un dessinateur btiment. Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02 lcole. Le premier a 23 ans et le dernier a 08ans. Ama travaille comme revendeuse de riz depuis 1990. Elle vend toute personne la maison et achte ses ingrdients au march Sa difficult principale est la concurrence sur le march. Ama a requis son second crdit de WAGES afin dacheter du riz, de lhuile, de la pte alimentaire et de la tomate pour la restauration. Elle veut rinvestir dans lactivit afin de rpondre plus la demande. Dans les prochaines annes, Ama voudrait agrandir son activit. Elle dit quavec les profits, Elle prvoit intervenir dans lducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ama is a 43 year old woman. She is married to a building designer. She has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. The eldest is 23 and the youngest 8 years old. Ama has worked as a rice seller since 1990. She sells to everybody from her home, and buys her ingredients in the market. Her main difficulty is competition in the market. Ama seeks her second loan from WAGES in order to buy rice, oil, corn meal and tomatoes to prepare dishes. She wishes to reinvest in her business to better meet the demand. In the next several years, Ama would like to increase her business. She states that with her profits, she will be able to assist with the education of her children.

loan.use: to purchase ingredients

loan.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
Lolita has had a food shop or "sari-sari store" for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Lolita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, age 35, is a widow with one child who is nine years old. She runs a grocery stall that gives her a monthly income of Kes. 6,200.
This is her second loan with KADET. Jane has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy vegetables, tomatoes, carrots, and onions to sell. Jane hopes to open a wholesale grocery in the future.

loan.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, carrots, and onions to sell.

loan.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, age 43 years, is married to Charles and is blessed with two children- aged 16 and 18 years. She sells timber, which she has been doing for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes. 34,000.
This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy more timber to sell. Esther hopes to become a renowned timber supplier in the future.

loan.use: to buy timber to sell

loan.name: Ai Sas

texts.en: Ai Sas, 27 years-old, is married, and resides with her husband and her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a blacksmith who produces knives, swords and axes to sell. Ai Sas is requesting a loan of USD 600 in order to purchase more steel for her husband to produce more knives and axes to sell for his clients. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business by investing more money to run a shop which sell knives, swords and axes. Moreover, she plans to build a new house next year.

loan.use: to purchase more steel for her husband to produce more knives and axes to sell.

loan.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a farmer, and he is her partner in managing their rice farming business. She has been in this business for over 20 years. Her long duration in farming makes her expertise perfect for the task.
Milagros's neighbors seldom see her just having fun. For her, time is money -- thats why she keeps busy in their field and only visits when their crop is in good condition. Milagros's income from the business depends on the climate. She worries when a typhoon comes or drought and pests hit her crops. Milagros is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care.

loan.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loan.name: Naida

texts.en: Naida is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has been selling tea in Yambio, South Sudan, for four years. Naida is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase sugar and coffee.

loan.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 44 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines.
Ruth has a shop where she provides internet access and encoding of documents. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for the electricity for the services.
Ruth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to pay for electricity for her business.

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old married man. He has been the owner of a cow farm since 1997. His agriculture business is very important to him, it's his only income source.
Mohamad is a hard worker, it's his first time to experience dealing with Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He has done so in order to increase his cattle through buying extra cows, which will definitely increase his income through their increased production.
Mohamad hopes to keep on expanding his business through introducing new animals to his farm in order to increase future production.

loan.use: to buy new cows to increase his cattle production.

loan.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
Fe has had a food shop or "sari-sari" store for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Fe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loan.name: Essodjolo

texts.fr: Essodjolo est une femme g(e) de 39 ans. Elle est marie un policier. Elle a 03 enfants dont 02 scolariss. Lain a 24ans et le dernier 08ans. Essodjolo travaille comme revendeuse de mas et sorgho depuis 1991. Elle vend seule ses clients et achte les produits Lom. Elle na pas de difficult principale. Essodjolo a requis son second crdit de WAGES afin dacheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut rinvestir dans lactivit. Dans les prochaines annes, Essodjolo voudrait agrandir lactivit Elle dit quavec les profits, Elle prvoit assurer la scolarit de ses enfants et construire une maison.
texts.en: Essodjolo is a 39 year old woman. She is married to a policeman. She has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. The eldest is 24 and the youngest 8 years old. Essodjolo has worked as a reseller of corn and sorghum since 1991. She sells alone to her customers and buys the products in Lom. She has no specific difficulty. Essodjolo needs her second loan with WAGES in order to buy more stock. She wants to re-invest in her business. In the years to come, Essodjolo would like to grow her business. She states that with her profits, she intends to ensure her childrens' education and to build a home.

loan.use: to buy bags of corn and sorghum

loan.name: Adonai Group

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Ennety from Machipisa, Harare. She is married with three children. She also cares for two dependents.
Ennety runs a retail business selling clothes she buys from South Africa and Zambia. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenges she faces are high import duty charges and other charges required by the Revenue Authority of Zimbabwe for locally available products. Ennety has requested a loan of $400 to buy additional stocks of clothes to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family. In the future, Ennety plans to own a clothing shop and to be able to employ at least 3 workers.

loan.use: to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loan.name: Jali

texts.en: Jali has been involved in sowing cereal crops for over 30 years. He is 70 years, married and has six children. His daughter works at a dekhan farm. Jali is requesting this loan for sowing cereal crops.

loan.use: to purchase seeds and fuel

loan.name: Reachny

texts.en: Reachny, 22 years-old, is married, and resides with her husband and her parents in-law in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a truck driver. Reachny is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 in order to purchase construction material to build her house. In the future, she plans to runs a business of buying and selling rice.

loan.use: to purchase construction material to build her house.

loan.name: John

texts.en:
John, aged 27 years-old, is married to Beatrice and they are blessed with one child. He has been selling trousers for six years which gives him a monthly income of Kes. 20,000.
This is his first loan with Kiva partner KADET. He will use the funds to buy more trousers for sale. John will use the expected profits to open a boutique and hopes to educate his child.

loan.use: to buy clothing stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more items like timber and machines for cutting timber.

loan.name: Djouma

texts.fr: Djoumai est une femme g(e) de 42 ans. Elle est marie un chauffeur . Elle a 04 enfants, dont 02 lcole. Le premier a 16 ans et le dernier a 07 ans. Djoumai travaille comme revendeuse de crales depuis 2004. Elle vend seule ses clients la maison et achte Lom. Elle na pas de difficult principale. Djoumai a requis son troisime crdit de WAGES afin dacheter des crales et des ignames. Elle veut agrandir lactivit. Dans les prochaines annes, Djoumai voudrait ajouter dautres activits telles que la vente de charbons de bois( combustible trs utilis par les femmes togolaise la cuisine). Elle dit quavec les profits, Elle prvoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Djoumai is a 42-year-old woman. She is married to a driver and has four children ranging from 7 to 16 years. Two of her children attend school. Djoumai has been working as a grain reseller since 2004. She buys her merchandise in Lom and sells alone, from home, to her customers. She has no particular difficulty. Djoumai has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to buy grains and yams. She wants to expand her business. In the coming years, Djoumai would like to add other activities such as selling charcoal (a fuel commonly used for cooking by women in Togo). She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family's basic needs.

loan.use: To buy grains.

loan.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is a 23-year-old married woman with two children; one in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for the past two years. Roda is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loan.name: Haykuhi

texts.en:
Haykuhi is 24 years-old. She is married and has two small children. Haykuhi and her family live in Vanadzor city.
For more than a year Haykuhi has run her own food and household goods trading business. She rents a shop where she sells produce, which she buys from suppliers. Haykuhis husband is a trainee at one of the Vanadzor organizations and every evening and weekend he helps his wife in the shop. Thanks to the business Haykuhi and her husband provide for their young family.
Haykuhi is seeking for a loan of 800.000 AMD in order to buy beverages, candies, various canned foods, household goods, etc. for her shop. This will help Haykuhi to increase her shops assortment before the New Years holiday, when trading is very active.

loan.use: to buy beverages, candies, various canned foods, household goods, etc. for her shop

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old and is married to Linet. They have one child.
He has been in the business for the last five years, from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 80,000. He is applying for his second loan of Kes 40,000. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.
He hopes to use the profits to buy more artwork products to sell, and he hopes to become an international exporter of artifacts.

loan.use: to buy more artwork and artifacts to sell

loan.name: Hayitmuhamad

texts.en: Hayitmuhamad is involved in agriculture. He has been growing vegetables for sale for over ten years. He is 30 years old, married and has three children. Besides this business, Hayitmuhamad owns a tractor and provides a service using his tractor in his free time. He is requesting this loan to plant legume crops.

loan.use: to plant legume crops

loan.name: Amvi

texts.fr: Amvi est une femme g(e) de 29 ans. Elle est marie un entrepreneur et a 02 enfants. Amvi travaille comme revendeuse de produits dalimentation gnrale depuis 2000. Elle vend domicile aprs stre approvisionn dans les marchs environnants. Amvi a requis son premier crdit de WAGES afin dacheter des marchandises pour rpondre la demande de la clientle. Elle veut rinvestir dans son activit avec les profits raliss. Dans les prochaines annes, Amvi voudrait augmenter son activit afin de mieux soccuper de son mnage.
texts.en: Amvi is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to an entrepreneur and has two children. Amvi has been reselling general food products since 2000. She buys her products at nearby markets and sells from home. Amvi has required her first loan from WAGES in order to buy merchandises to meet her customers' demand. With the profits, she would like to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Amvi would like to increase her activity in order to take better care of her household.

loan.use: To buy general food items.

loan.name: Christ Yancy

texts.en:
Christ Yancy needs to work hard to earn profit for his wife and child. At 19, he already has one infant child. He knows that he is still young to engage in the hardship of farming, but he has the responsibility to provide for the needs of his loving family.
To make a living, he is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to improve his farming business. Through them, he will be able to gain abundant crops to sell and earn enough funds to support his family.

loan.use: to buy farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to improve his farming business.

loan.name: Annetten

texts.en: Annetten is 27 years-old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with two children aged three and six years old. The children are attending school and all live at home. Annette has been selling used shoes for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it pays her children's school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used shoes for her business, in the future she want to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loan.use: to purchase more used shoes for her business.

loan.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 34-year-old who helps her husband with their primary source of income. She has already spent six years in the farming business. Having five children is difficult for her because this size of family is more expensive than a little number, so Mary Jane doubles her occupation. Aside from the farming business, she also cares for chickens and hogs as additional sources of livelihood.
To make their business thrive, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy corn seeds and fertilizers, and feeds for her hogs. She hopes to make a profit out of her loan in order to send her five children to school to finish their preferred courses.

loan.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers, and feeds for her hogs.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase home appliances

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy clothes, shoes, blankets and traveling bags.

loan.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 32 years-old and lives in Congo Town; she is single with a child aged one year old that lives at home. Mamie has been selling biscuits, candy, and soft drinks for the past two years. She started this business with money received from her friend, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it help to take care of her family, She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits and soft drinks for her business. In the future she wants to own a house.

loan.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, and soft drinks for her business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more items like the local fish.

loan.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 36 years-old and lives in Congo Town; she is single with four children aged 3 and 15 years old. They are attending school and live at home.
Musu has been operating a photo studio for the past ten years. She says her main challenge is sometimes customers take photos and they dont pay the balance of fees owing. She started this business with money that she earned (as a cook) and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her increased profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more materials (camera, cloths, etc.) for her business, in the future she want to send her children to a good university.

loan.use: to purchase more materials (camera, cloths, etc.) for her business.

loan.name: Kinbongin Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rasmata est la reprsentante du groupe KINBONGIN. Elle est clibataire et mre de 05enfants. Le plus g a 20ans et le moins g a 03ans. 04 vont lcole. Elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Elle vend du jus de bissaps, jus de gingembre (gnamakou) et des lgumes depuis 01an. Elle sapprovisionne Laafie yaar en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et enfants.
Elle veut sacheter 01sac de bissaps, 01sac de sucre et 05 plats de gingembre.
Mme pargne ses bnfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son affaire et assurer la scolarit de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative for the Kinbongin Group. She is a single woman and the mother of five children from ages 3 to 20. Four of the children are in school. She has seven dependents.
For one year, she has been selling hibiscus flowers, ginger juice (gnamakou) and vegetables. She buys her stock in town at Laafie Yaar [market]. Her customers are men, women, and children.
She would like to purchase one sac of hibiscus flowers, one sac of sugar, and five flats of ginger.
Rasmata saves her profits. She aspires to grow her business and ensure her childrens education.

loan.use: to purchase one sac of hibiscus, one sac of sugar, and five flats of ginger.

loan.name: Titonangba Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TITONANGBA est compos de deux personnes qui sont de la mme famille. C'est la deuxime fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALID, afin d'lever le niveau de leur activit. La reprsentante du groupe, du nom de Rafatou est celle qui a la main leve sur la photo. Rafatou na pas frquent lcole. Rafatou est ge de 59 ans et est une veuve. Rafatou est mre de cinq enfants, dont trois restent sa charge. Rafatou assure seule les diverses charges de ses enfants. Pour y parvenir, Rafatou mne comme activit depuis dix-sept ans environs la vente des emballages de "pure water" son domicile. Cette activit lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficult ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Rafatou sapprovisionne au Bnin. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et pour accrotre son chiffre daffaire et son revenu, Rafatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TITONAGBA, un deuxime crdit auprs de ALID. Le premier prt a t bien rembours.
texts.en:
The Titonangba group is made up of 2 people who are both members of the same family. The group would like to increase their business activity and, for this reason, are requesting their 2nd loan from ALID.
Rafatou, the representative of the group, has her hand raised in the picture. She is 59 years old, widowed and the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are still dependent on her.
Rafatou covers her childrens various expenses by herself. She did not go to school and, in order to be able to take care of childrens needs, has been selling "Pure Water" from her home for the past 17 years. She gets her supplies in Benin and the income from her business enables her to meet both her needs and those of her children without too much difficulty.
Rafatou and the other member of the Titonangba group are requesting their 2nd loan from ALID in order to be able to restock on supplies, so that they can satisfy customer demand, increase their sales and their income. The group fully repaid their first loan.

loan.use: to buy packages of "Pure Water" for resale.

loan.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 46-years-old, married and is the mother of three children. She has been in farming for the last ten years. She helps her husband in operating their business such as planting corn even in the midst of the sun or serious rain. She puts aside the difficulties of working in the field, instead she is inspired to work hard for the future of her family.
She is requesting a loan in the amount of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used to prevent disastrous pests. She hopes that these farm supplies will be a great help in the preparation of her business to produce abundant crops.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used to prevent disastrous pests.

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es: La seora Francisca es de la ciudad de It, tiene 68 aos de edad, vive acompaada con el seor Amado, tiene 8 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes a ella. La misma posee 4 vacas lecheras, gallinas y cerdos. Nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche, carne de cerdo y huevos hace varios aos, su cnyuge es albail. Ambos se ayudan por medio de su trabajo para poder sacar adelante la casa y de esa forma poder tener una vejez digna. El sueo de ella es poder seguir creciendo y tener ms animales, es por ello que solicita el crdito. Desea el crdito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con lo cual podr aumentar su produccin de leche. Agradece la oportunidad dada a kiva y a la fundacin paraguaya.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca lives in the city of It. She is 68 and lives with her common-law husband, Amado. She has eight adult children who live independently.
She has four dairy cows, chickens and pigs. For several years she has been selling milk, pork and eggs. Her husband is a bricklayer. They work together to provide for the household and prepare for retirement. Her dream is to continue growing and have more livestock, therefore she is requesting the loan.
She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production. She is grateful for this opportunity from Kiva and the Fundacin Paraguaya.

loan.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loan.name: Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO est compos de trois personnes qui vivent dans le mme quartier. C'est la troisime fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALID, afin d'lever le niveau de son activit. La reprsentante du groupe, du nom de Eya est celle qui a la main leve sur la photo. Eya est ge de 25 ans et vit au Bnin. Eya na pas frquent lcole. Eya est marie un tailleur du nom de Anselme. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolariss et deux restent sa charge. Eya vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Depuis deux ans environs, Eya vend des ustensiles de cuisine de faon ambulante. Eya sapprovisionne dans un march du Bnin. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et pour accrotre son chiffre daffaires et son revenu, Eya sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO, un troisime crdit auprs de ALID. Les deux premiers prts ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en:
The Mahukpego group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. It is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from Alid, in order to raise their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Eya, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Eya is 25 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school and she is married to a tailor called Anselme. The couple has four children, some of whom are at school and two of whom are in their care. Eya lives with her husband and her children.
She has been selling kitchen utensils on a door-to-door basis for around two years and gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Eya is, together with the other members of the Mahukpego group, requesting a third loan from Alid. The first two loans were repaid in full.

loan.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loan.name: Avan-Nah Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVAN-NAH est compos de trois personnes qui habitent le mme quartier. C'est la premire fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALID, afin d'lever le niveau de son activit. La reprsentante du groupe, du nom de Kwassial Hermance est celle qui a la main leve sur la photo. Kwassial Hermance est ge de 38 ans et vit au Bnin. Kwassial Hermance a arrt lcole au cours primaire. Kwassial Hermance est marie un lectricien du nom de Norbert. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolariss et leur charge. Kwassial Hermance vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Kwassial Hermance vend depuis cinq ans environs, des produits cosmtiques et des mches son domicile. Kwassial Hermance sapprovisionne dans un march du Bnin et au Togo. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et pour accrotre son chiffre daffaires et son revenu, Kwassial Hermance sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AVAN-NAH, un premier crdit auprs de ALID.
texts.en: AVAN-NAH is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALID, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Kwassial Hermance, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Kwassial Hermance is 38 and lives in Benin. Kwassial Hermance quit school at the primary level. She is married to an electrician named Norbert. They care for their 2 children, who both go to school. Kwassial Hermance lives with her husband and her children. In order to meet the financial needs of her family, she has been selling cosmetic products and hair extensions from home for about 5 years. Kwassial Hermance buys those items in markets in Benin and in Togo. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Kwassial Hermance, along with the other members of the group, is applying for this first loan from ALID.

loan.use: to buy cosmetic products and hair extensions.

loan.name: Oluwatogni Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLUWATOGNI est compos de trois personnes qui rsident dans le mme quartier. C'est la troisime fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALID, afin d'lever le niveau de son activit. La reprsentante du groupe, du nom de Fidle Rachelle est celle qui a la main leve sur la photo. Fidle Rachelle est ge de 38 ans et vit au Bnin. Fidle Rachelle na pas frquent lcole. Fidle Rachelle est marie un mcanicien du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolariss et tous leur charge. Fidle Rachelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Afin dassurer les diverses charges de la famille, Fidle Rachelle vend de lhuile moteur son domicile. Fidle Rachelle sapprovisionne dans un march du Bnin. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et pour accrotre son chiffre daffaires et son revenu, Fidle Rachelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLUWATOGNI, un troisime crdit auprs de ALID. Les deux premiers prts ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en:
The OLUWATOGNI group is made up of three people who all live in the same part of town. This is the third time that this group is asking for a loan from ALID, in order to improve its business.
The representative of the group, Fidle Rachelle, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Fidle Rachelle is 38 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend attend school. She is married to a mechanic named Joseph. They have four children, some of whom attend school. All four children are still in their care. Fidle Rachelle lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple provides for their family.
In order to cover the various family expenses, Fidle Rachelle sells motor oil from her home. She buys the motor oil from a market in Benin.
Hoping to be able to increase her sales and revenue, and satisfy her customers, Fidle Rachelle, along with the other members of the OLUWATOGNI group, is asking for a third loan through ALID. The two previous loans were both paid back in full.

loan.use: to buy motor oil

loan.name: Federico

texts.es: El Sr. Federico tiene 22 aos de edad, es soltero, vive con su abuelo debido a que sus padres se separaron y su madre esta en la Argentina. Federico es un joven muy sacrificado pues tiene que trabajar para ayudar a su abuelo con los gastos del hogar y adems tiene que pagar sus estudios. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa de telefona celular como vendedor, y esta cursando el tercer ao de la carrera de Administracin en donde asiste a clases de lunes a viernes a la noche despus de su trabajo. Nos comenta que su sueo es poder convertirse en una persona importante, que sea til no solo a si mismo, sino tambin a su familia y a la sociedad. Solicita el prstamo para la compra de libros y pagar derechos de examen, y de esa forma poder aliviaran la carga de sus estudios. Agradece por esta gran oportunidad que se le da.
texts.en:
Mr. Federico is 22, single and lives with his grandfather because his parents are divorced and his mother is in Argentina. Federico is a self-sacrificed young man who must work to help his grandfather with household expenses. He also must pay for his education.
Currently he is working for a cell phone company as a salesman and he is in his third year of business administration studies. He attends class after work Monday through Friday.
He tells us his dream is to become someone important, not only for himself but also for his family and society. He is requesting the loan to buy books and pay exam fees, which will ease the burden of studying. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loan.use: To buy books and pay exam fees.

loan.name: Odjooba Group

texts.fr: ODJOOBA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres rsident dans le mme quartier. La reprsentante du groupe Nansirathou Adjok (dont la main est leve sur la photo), est ge de 35 ans et est marie un certain Fataye. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolariss et tous leur charge. Nansirathou Adjok vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diffrentes charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Nansirathou Adjok vend depuis une dizaine dannes de la nourriture (riz et de la sauce) dans son quartier. Paralllement cette activit, Nansirathou Adjok vend de divers produits. Nansirathou Adjok achte ses produits dans un march du Bnin. Cest la premire fois que Nansirathou Adjok et les autres membres du groupe ODJOOBA sollicitent lappui financier de ALID en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activit et de mieux rpondre aux exigences de leur clientle.
texts.en: ODJOOBA is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Nansirathou Adjok (the one raising her hand on the picture), is 35 and is married to a man called Fataye. They care for their 3 children, some of whom go to school. Nansirathou Adjok lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. To do that, Nansirathou Adjok has been selling food (rice and sauce) in her neighborhood for about 10 years. In addition to this occupation, Nansirathou Adjok sells miscellaneous items. Nansirathou Adjok buys those items in a market in Benin. It is the first time that Nansirathou Adjok and the other members of the ODJOOBA group are applying for financial support from ALID, in order to strengthen their business and to better meet the needs of their customers.

loan.use: to buy rice and miscellaneous items.

loan.name: Cir

texts.fr: Madame Cir ge de 51 ans est marie et mre de six enfants dont le plus jeune a neuf ans et lain, vingt quatre ans. Elle a une exprience de dix ans dans le mtier. Avec le crdit elle va continuer son activit de tous les jours : vente de beignets mais veut aussi acheter pour revendre de lor. Madame Cir veille lducation de ses enfants en participant leur scolarit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cir, age 51, is married and the mother of six children. The youngest is 9, and the eldest is 24 years old. She has ten years of experience in her business, which consists in selling doughnuts.
She will use her loan to sustain her business, as well as for trading gold. Mrs. Cir takes care of her children's education by contributing to their schooling expenses.

loan.use: to buy ingredients to make and sell doughnuts, as well as to invest in gold trading

loan.name: Paz Y Unidad Group

texts.es: El comit "Paz y Unidad" se origin a traves de promociones que se realizaron en el barrio de las miembros. Todas son vecinas y amigas del barrio, se pusieron como objetivo trabajar, fomentar el espritu solidario de cada una y llegar al nivel mximo del programa. La sra. Margarita es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica en la venta de chipa (alimento tradicional de Paraguay), nos comenta que tiene muchas ganas de progresar y de trabajar para poder ayudar a su familia, ya que ellos son su razn de lucha. Uno de sus deseos es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma generar un poco mas de ingresos. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de almidn, manteca, huevos, condimentos y dems insumos necesarios para elaborar la chipa que vende.
texts.en:
The committee Paz y Unidad, or Peace and Unity, began through promotions that took place in the members neighborhood. They are all neighbors and friends in the neighborhood. They made it their goal to work, fomenting a spirit of solidarity among each member, and carry their program out to its fullest potential.
Margarita is the president of the group. She sells chipa, (a Paraguayan traditional food) [a cheese bread often made with corn or manioc flour]. She says that she is driven to make progress and to work to help her family, since they are her reason for fighting. One of her wishes is to continue growing to earn a little more income.
She is requesting the loan to purchase starch, lard, eggs, seasoning, and other ingredients necessary to make the chispa that she sells.

loan.use: purchase starch, lard, eggs, seasoning, and other ingredients to make chipa

loan.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 27 years old and single. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a principled man.
He has been selling water in a busy place for the last one year. His business is faced with a problem of low purchasing power from the customers.
He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more containers for water storage. Stephen's hopes and dreams are to have a permanent place for selling water in the next five years.

loan.use: To buy more water containers for water storage.

loan.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl does farming activities to minimize the hardship on her husband to manage their source of income. Since she was married to Nio, she has experience in operating a farming business. She doesnt care about her own interest. Instead she cares for the welfare of her one infant child. Now that she had her own family, she is responsibly working in the field to give a bright future for her child.
At 22, she is experienced working on their farm for one year and earned P10,000. She wants to earn more, so she is asking a loan amount P15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve their crops. Hopefully, through providing complete supplies, they would be able to gain enough income for her family.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve their crops.

loan.name: Asoson Asin Osur

texts.en: Asin is 28 years old, married, and has a two year old son. He describes himself as a welcoming and principled man. He has been running three pharmacy retail stores for the last three years. He sells syringes, tablets and surgical products. He has two employees. His primary customers are local residents. His business faces a challenge of insufficient funds for maintaining supplies. He will use the loan Kes 20,000 to buy tablets and surgical products. In the future, Asin hopes and dreams to run several retail stores.

loan.use: To buy tablets and surgical products.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy shoes and kitchenware

loan.name: Wendlabangre Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABO est la reprsentante du groupe WENDLABANGRE. Elle est marie et mre de 05enfants. Le plus g a 27ans et le moins g a 14ans. 02 vont lcole. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Elle vend des sandwich et des bonbons depuis 22ans. Elle sapprovisionne la boulangerie Wend Konta en ville. Ses clients sont les lves car elle vend dans les coles.
Elle veut sacheter 01 bidon dhuile de 20l pour la prparation du sandwich et 05 cartons de bonbons.
Mme pargne ses bnfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son affaire et assurer la scolarit de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zoenabo is the representative for the Wendlabangre Group. She is married and the mother of five children from ages 14 to 27. Two of her children are in school; she has five dependents.
Zoenabo has sold sandwiches and candy for 22 years. She stocks up at the Wend Konta bakery in town. Her customers are students as she sells in schools.
She would like to purchase one 20 litre drum of oil for the preparation of sandwiches, and five boxes of candy.
Zoenabo saves her profits. She aspires to grow her business and ensure her childrens education.

loan.use: to purchase one 20 litre drum of oil for preparing sandwiches and five boxes of candy.

loan.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is 34-years of age, happily married to Milagros and currently working as a farmer. He is a responsible and industrious father of five children. His priority is to increase his income through improving his farming business to provide the necessities needed by his family.
He is requesting a loan amount of P15,000 as additional capital in buying inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to develop their livelihood. He hopes, through these inputs, he can achieve his priority.

loan.use: to buy inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to develop their livelihood.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy second hand clothing

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more used shoes for her business.

loan.name: Milagros 2 Group

texts.es: Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnacin, surgi por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundacin, el grupo se encuentra en el octavo ciclo, opera con la Fundacin desde el ao 2009. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, cuyo objetivo principal es ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Sofia, ella tiene 3 hijos, esta acompaada con Ricardo, su marido trabaja como Pasero y ella se dedica hace varios aos a la compra y venta de productos de todo tipo, como fideos, arroz, azcar, y dems productos de primera necesidad. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de arroz, azcar, fideos, yerba y dems insumos para abastecerse y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group from the city Encarnacin came about through contact with one of the members of the foundation. The group is in the eighth loan cycle and has worked with the foundation since 2009. The members are fighters and hardworking women. Their main objective is to help each other through working together.
One of the members of the group is Sofia. She lives together with her husband and has 3 children. He works ferrying people across a river.
She has worked for several years buying and selling all kinds of products, such as beans, rice, sugar, and other staples.
Sofia is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, herbs, and other basic goods to be fully stocked, which would allow her to continue growing and helping her family.

loan.use: buy rice, sugar, beans, herbs, and other staples

loan.name: Shamsidin

texts.en: Shamsidin is a resident of the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has ten children. Shamsidin is involved in growing vegetables. He has been in this business for 15 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel.

loan.use: to purchase fuel

loan.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres rsident dans le mme quartier au Bnin. La reprsentante du groupe, Vronique (dont la main est leve sur la photo), est ge de 33 ans et est marie un certain Grard. Vronique a arrt lcole au niveau primaire. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolariss et leur charge. Vronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face ses diffrentes charges, Vronique vend depuis huit ans, du charbon de bois dans son quartier. Vronique sapprovisionne dans un march du Bnin. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et en vue largir son activit, Vronique sollicite un troisime crdit auprs de ALID, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO. Ce crdit leur servira mieux rpondre aux demandes de leur clientle et se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers crdits ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en:
GBENONKPO Group is made up of two women who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Vronique, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 33 years old and married to one Grard.
The couple has two school-attending children to support. Vronique lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.
Vronique dropped out of elementary school. To provide for herself and her family, she's been selling charcoal in her neighborhood for eight years.
She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Eager to meet customer demand and in order to bolster her business, she's seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALID, together with the other members of the group.
This loan will enable them to better meet customer demand and increase their profits. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loan.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loan.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 33 year-old businesswoman who is married to Isaac, also a businessman. They are blessed with one child. She has been running a greengrocery business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 9,500 which she uses to support her familys needs.
She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Janet will use the loan to buy more stock of green vegetables and fruit to add to her business. With the anticipated profits from the business, she plans to save to be able to educate her child.
Her future hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: To buy stock of green vegetables and fruit to add to her business

loan.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 29 year-old businessman who is married to Mwikali, a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged 4 and 3 years respectively. John has been in a welding business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to buy more metal rods for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children.
His dream is to soon be able to open a retail shop for his wife.

loan.use: To buy metal rods for his business

loan.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sta. Sonia, es de ciudad del Este, ella es soltera vive aun con sus padres. Tiene un pequeo negocio donde realiza recarga de lneas telefnicas, fotocopias y venta de algunos artculos de primera necesidad, como ser fideos, arroz, azcar, panificados y dems. Nos cuenta que consigui montar su negocio con un pequeo crdito que le haba otorgado la fundacin y ella hizo trabajar el capital y de esa forma fue creciendo. Hoy da ella ha aumentado sus ingresos personales y de esa forma tambin ayuda en los gastos del hogar a sus padres. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y en vistas a ese sueo es que solicita el crdito para la compra de artculos de primera necesidad, como ser fideo, azcar, yerba, panificados y dems. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da.
texts.en:
Sonia is from the Ciudad del Este. She is single and still lives with her parents. She has a small business where she recharges telephone lines, makes photocopies, and sells some basic needs items like noodles, rice, sugar, baked goods, and more.
She tells us that she succeeded in setting up her business with a small loan that the Fundacin had granted her. She made the capital work, and the business was growing. She has now increased her personal income, and this is how she also helps her parents with the household expenses.
She is a very tenacious and honest person. She is known and cherished by the people who live in this neighborhood. Her goal is to be able to continue growning.
In light of this dream, she is requesting a loan to buy staple items like noodles, sugar, herbs, baked goods, and more. She is grateful for the opportunity that is being given to her.

loan.use: Comprar fideo, azcar, yerba, panificados y dems

loan.name: La Cle De David Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA CLE DE DAVID est form de trois personnes qui habitent dans le mme quartier. La reprsentante de ce groupe, nomme Sophie Akouavi, est celle dont la main est leve sur la photo. Cest la troisime fois que ce groupe sollicite lappui financier dALID en vue dlever le niveau de leur activit. Sophie Akouavi est ge de 33 ans et est marie un chauffeur du nom de Michel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolariss et leur charge. Sophie Akouavi a arrt lcole au cours primaire. Depuis une vingtaine danne, Sophie Akouavi vend de lhuile de palme et du ptrole dans un march du Bnin. Sophie Akouavi achte ses produits dans le mme march au Bnin. Dans le but daugmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux rpondre la demande de sa clientle, Sophie Akouavi dsire obtenir un troisime crdit auprs de ALID, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA CLE DE DAVID. Les crdits prcdents ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en:
LA CLE DE DAVID Group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Sophie Akouavi, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALID, in order to bolster their businesses.
