Sophie Akouavi is 33 years old and married to a driver named Michel. The couple has four school-attending children to support. Sophie Akouavi dropped out of elementary school. For about twenty years, she's been selling palm oil and fuel in one of Benin's market.
She gets her supplies from the same market. In order to bolster her stocks and better meet customer demand, she's seeking a third loan from ALID, together with the other members of the group. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

loan.use: to buy cans of palm oil and fuel

loan.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald has owned and managed his corn fields for almost nine years. He is 26 years old, married to Marilyn, and blessed with two children. He is very happy to have children because they serve as his inspiration to work. Despite the hardships and difficulties he faces in cultivating his farm land, he is lucky because he has enough strength to work hard in the field to support the needs and wants of his family. Ronald is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for his business. He will use it to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to make his corn field more productive. He hopes to increase his profit to save for his children's future and lift his family out of poverty.

loan.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loan.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 21 year-old businessman. He is single, and he has been running an electronic shop for the past year with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to fulfill his basic needs.
He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Timothy will use the loan to buy electrical parts and to stock more electronic items (iron boxes, radios, TVs) for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will save to have more capital to be able to expand his business.
He hopes to buy commercial land in the near future.

loan.use: To buy electrical spare parts and other electronics for his business

loan.name: Egamberdi

texts.en: Egamberdi lives in the Yavan district. He is 41 years old, married and has three children. His son is a construction worker. Egamberdi grows vegetables for sale. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loan.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loan.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is 43 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is a widow with four children ages 15 to 27 years old. Three of the children are attending college and living on their own, while the youngest one is in school and living at home.
Bindu has been selling necklaces and earrings for the past ten years. She started this business with money given to her by her brothers and she learned the business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (necklaces and earrings) for her business. In the future she want to educate all her children through the college level.

loan.use: to purchase more necklaces and earrings for her business

loan.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 25 years old, is married. She has a daughter and a son who are six months old and three years old. For the last four years, she has been selling tomatoes, potatoes, pawpaws, bananas and peas to hotels and residents. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to add the stock of fruit and vegetables. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more potatoes, tomatoes and pawpaw. In the future, Jane hopes to be selling vegetables and fruits at wholesale.

loan.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes and pawpaws.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loan.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Jean fait le commerce des habits en dtail. Il a 31 ans et il est mari avec 3 enfants de 2 11 ans, dont 2 scolariss. Son niveau dducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Cest son troisime cycle de prt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crdit pour augmenter le capital de son commerce des habits.
Sa stratgie pour la croissance de son business est daugmenter continuellement son capital en fin de satisfaire toutes les demandes de ses clients. Ceci lui permettra dtre grossiste dans les annes venir. Avec les profits, il prvoit dduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean is a clothing outfit retailer. He is 31 years old and is married with 3 children, aged from 2 to 11, two of whom are in school. He completed 6 years of primary education. This is his third successive loan with ACB. He will use this loan to increase the stock of his clothing outfit business. His strategy for growing the business is to continually add to the stock in order to meet all the needs of his customers. This will allow him to become a wholesaler in the years to come. With the profits, he plans to educate his children in school.

loan.use: to increase the stock in his business selling outfits

loan.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53-year-old married man, the father of six children. He has worked as a car mechanic for 35 years. This long experience gave him customers' trust and support. He opened his current garage in 1997, and it is well known in the region.
Ali works hard for his family's happiness, he sacrifices his life for theirs. To provide his children with the best education, Ali requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for their school fees.
This is Ali's second experience with Al Majmoua, and his previous one was very impressive, it reflected positively on both his social and financial situations.
Ali is looking forward to improving and updating his business as much as he can in the future.

loan.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loan.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es: La formacin del presente grupo fue gracias a una de las miembros, que invit a sus amigas y vecinas a formar el grupo, en busca de un bien para todas ellas. Actualmente el grupo est integrado por 17 mujeres, muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, quienes estn trabajando en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundacin Paraguaya. Una de las miembros es la seora Yanina, quien trabaja todos los das para poder darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesiten, para que no tengan que pasar por ningn tipo de privaciones. Ella se dedica a la venta de variadas prendas, su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma tener un poco ms de ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia. Solicita el crdito para abastecerse con prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere tener un buen stock de prendas para cuando su cliente se las pida.
texts.en:
The formation of this group was thanks to one of the members who invited her friends and neighbors to form the group, in search of good for them all. Currently this group has 17 women, very hard workers and fighters, who are working in their 2nd cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs of the Paraguayan Foundation.
One of the members is Yanina who works every day to give her family everything that they need so that they do not lack anything. She works selling various kinds of garments. Her desire is to be able to continue growing so that she will have more income in order to continue helping her family.
She is asking for the loan in order to stock the business with summer outfits as it is going to be hot soon and she wants to have a good stock of clothing when her clients make a request.

loan.use: to buy clothing to sell

loan.name: Nazgul

texts.en: Nazgul is 35 years old, married and is raising five children. In search of a source for financial support for her family, she started her own business of fattening up and reselling livestock ten years ago, using an initial sum of 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent work, Nazgul's business currently yields about 8,000 som per month from sale of milk and meat products. In order to further grow her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls for fattening up. Nazgul plans to invest the profits from this loan into building a new, comfortable barn for the livestock, and, in the future, further increasing livestock headcount.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Dehlia

texts.en: Dehlia is 36 years of age. She is married with three children. She is a farmer's wife who helps her husband in operating their farming business. She plants corn and cultivates the farm land to make it more productive. Dehlia has been in farming for five years and currently provides sacks of corn in their market every cropping season. Dehlia has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to improve their farming business. She hopes to increase her crops and provide more sacks of corn every cropping season. In this way, she will be able to earn a higher income to better their lives and save for her children's studies as well.

loan.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loan.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 47-year-old married lady living with her husband and their five children. She started her business 25 years ago at her home where she makes accessories and embroiders oriental dresses by hand to help her husband with the expenses of their household.
Being so popular among her family members, neighbors, and friends who like what she creates, Sahar decided to take a big step four years ago by starting her own dependent shop for accessories and handmade embroidery.
She would like to get a loan to help her expand her store, buy more raw materials, and display a new variety of products as she is now a productive member of the family and helps greatly with the household and the childrens expenses.
Because Sahar is a conservative person, she has asked her son Bara to appear in the photo.

loan.use: to help her expand her store, buy more raw materials, and display a new variety of products

loan.name: Hamideh

texts.en:
Hamideh is a 23-year-old Lebanese woman. She is engaged to be married. She lives with her sole parent and with three siblings, two of whom are working. She cooperates with her two siblings to cover the family's expenses.
Hamideh has been working as a tailor for the past seven years from her home. Shes well known as a reputable person and has gained a fair number of customers all over her village. Today, shes looking to borrow $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles and many others. This Kiva loan will boost her productivity, and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own evening-dress shop and expand her business outside the country.

loan.use: to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to increase the stock in her clothing retail business

loan.name: Telesia Mwende

texts.en:
Telesia, 42 years old, is married and has five children ranging from 6 to 21 years of age. She describes herself as a talkative and social woman.
For the last six years, she has been involved in greengrocery activity. She sells cabbages, tomatoes, bananas and mangoes. In addition, she sells maize and green peas sometimes to increase her source of income. Telesia is facing a challenge of insufficient funds in her business. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cabbages and potatoes.

loan.use: To buy cabbage and potatoes.

loan.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: 19 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se han unido con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundacin paraguaya. Una de las integrantes es la seora Mara, quien por medio de la venta de cosmticos logra tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Nos comenta que tiene buena venta debido a la variedad que siempre tiene, sumado a eso el buen precio y la amabilidad con que ella atiende a sus clientes. Desea poder seguir creciendo en su negocio, es por ello que solicita el crdito. Desea comprar maquillajes de todo tipo, con lo cual podr tener ms variedad y de esa forma atraer a ms clientas. Agradece a la fundacin por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Nineteen women in the Ciudad del Este have united with the purpose of working together and through this work getting ahead and helping one another. They are hard working women and fighters, and are in the eighth cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs of the Fundacin Paraguayan (Paraguayan Foundation).
One of the members is Mara, who by selling cosmetics succeeds by having the financial means necessary in order to be able to help her family. She comments to us that she has good sales because of the variety she always has, in addition to the good price and the friendliness with which she assists her customers. She wants to be able to continue growing her business, and this is why she is asking for a loan.
She wants to buy all types of makeup, with which she could have more variety and therefore attract more clients. She thanks the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her.

loan.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loan.name: Pauline

texts.fr:
Pauline fait le commerce des habits en dtail. Elle a 41 ans et elle est veuve et a 2 enfants de 13 17 ans, qui vont tous lcole. Elle a une autre personne en charge. Son niveau dducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Cest son deuxime cycle de prt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crdit pour augmenter le capital de son commerce des habits.
Sa stratgie pour la croissance de son business est de diversifier les sortes des habits quelle vend. Elle veut devenir grossiste dans le futur. Avec les profits, elle va payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et construire une maison.
texts.en: Pauline is a clothing retailer. She is 41 years old and a widow. She has two children ages 13 and 17 who both attend school. She also has one other dependent. She completed 6 years of primary education. This is her second loan with ACB. She will use her loan to increase the working capital of her clothing business. Her strategy for growing her business is to diversify the kinds of clothes she sells. She wants to become a wholesaler in the future. With the profits, she will pay her children's school fees and build a house.

loan.use: to increase the working capital of her clothing business.

loan.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 56-year-old businessman and he is married to Pauline. The couple is blessed with six children.
Julius has been operating a bicycle transportation business as his primary business and a retail shop as a secondary business for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Julius will use the loan to service his bike and to buy more stock of sugar and rice for his retail shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.
He hopes to buy commercial land in the near future.

loan.use: To service his bike and buy more sugar and rice for his shop

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase more home products.

loan.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is single with two children who are 6 and 12 years old. They are attending school and live at home.
Florence has been selling used clothing for the past 15 years. She says sometimes customer response to her business is slow. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business.
In the future she wants to become a international businesswoman.

loan.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business

loan.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 31-year-old single businessman. He has been running a barber shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to cater for his basic needs.
He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Isaac will use the loan to buy a shaving machine for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business he plans to expand his business.
He hopes to buy commercial land in the future.

loan.use: To buy a shaving machine for his business

loan.name: Goboza1 Group

texts.en: This is Lindiwe, a 35-year-old married woman with three children aged 11, 9 and 5 years old. Two of her children are still at school. She does not have other dependents who live with her. Lindiwe is in the business of photocopying in Masvingo town. She has been in the business for two years and has no employees. Lindiwe has requested a loan of $250 to buy stationery for use in her photocopying business. She buys these products in Masvingo town. With the income from the business she will be able to finish building her house in order to have a better shelter. Lindiwe says the business challenges she faces are high competition and the fact that some of her machines are not new and therefore need quite a bit of attention every now and then. She is planning on owning her own stationery shop in the Central Business District.

loan.use: to buy another printer and bond paper.

loan.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 34-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Mercy who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Geoffrey will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He plans to use the anticipated profits from the business for the education of his child.
He hopes to open a retail shop for his wife in the near future.

loan.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loan.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar es de la ciudad de Caaguaz, tiene 36 aos de edad, est casado con la Sra. Aida de 31 aos de edad, ellos tienen 3 hijos que estan cursando sus estudios primarios. Don Edgar es carpintero, desde hace 2 aos, el comenz como empleado por mucho tiempo, tiempo que le sirvi para aprender el oficio, para que luego vaya juntando su capital y poder hacerse de un negocio propio, as lo hizo, en la actualidad l fabrica muebles de todo tipo, para el seor donde trabajaba anteriormente. Comenta que su sueo es poder seguir creciendo, para tener un poco ms de ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia, y darle a sus hijos una buena educacin. Solicita este prstamo para comprar mas madera, para asi tener buen stock de productos terminados y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mr. Edgar, 36, is from the city of Caaguaz city, and is married to Mrs. Aida, 31 years old. They have 3 children who are enrolled in primary school. Don Edgar is a carpenter for 2 years now, he started as an employee for a long time, which helped him learn the craft, then go along with to take his capital and start his own business. He did it and manufactures furniture of any kind, for the man where he previously worked. He says his dream is to continue to grow, to have a little more income and thus help his family, and give his children a good education. He is requesting this loan to buy more wood, so that he has good stock of finished goods and to meet customer orders.

loan.use: to purchase carpentry materials.

loan.name: Ra'eda

texts.en: Ra'eda is a 37-year-old woman and a mother of three sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also works in agriculture to increase his income. Ra'eda wants to help her husband in paying for some necessary repairs to the family's vehicle, which they use for daily transport, such as changing the vehicle engine, changing the doors, painting, etc. Therefore, she needs to take a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN. This loan will enable Ra'eda to help her husband pay for vehicle repairs. This will increase the vehicle's efficiency and provide the family with comfortable conditions when travelling in the vehicle. Ra'eda is shown in the picture.

loan.use: to make necessary repairs to the family vehicle.

loan.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 46 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is a widow with two children aged 7 and 9 who are in school and live at home. Hawa has been selling rice, red oil, bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable), etc., for the past 12 years. She started this business with money given to her by her sisters and she learned this business from her mother.
Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, and bitter ball and many other items for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loan.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, bitter ball, etc., for her business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more stock of sugar and rice for her shop.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy chicks, medicines and stock feeds.

loan.name: Omu

texts.en:
Omu is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is married with four children aged 15 to 22 years old who are in school and live at home. Omu has been selling rice, oil, peanuts, butter, and onions for the past 25 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband.
Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loan.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business

loan.name: Karamatkan

texts.en:
The first Kiva loan helped Karamatkan to purchase cattle. Today she has a farm with six cows, six heifers, two bull-calves, and one horse, which allows her to earn about 5,000 KGS in a month.
Now, Karamatkan plans to broaden her business activities by land-cultivating. For this reason she is applying for her second Kiva loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase seeds of tomatoes and potatoes.

loan.use: to purchase seeds

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy a heifer and a goat

loan.name: Sharon Atieno

texts.en: Sharon is a widow and has three children ranging from two to seven years old. She is a polite and hardworking woman. For the last four years, she has been selling second-had clothes to frequent customers. Previously, she was involved in green grocery activity. She has a challenge of financial constraints in her business. She will be using the loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more clothes for selling. Sharon hopes and dreams to expand her business in the next five years.

loan.use: To buy clothes.

loan.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 31-year-old businessman married to Caroline who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 18,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Gabriel will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the harvest on his farm, he plans to save money towards the education of his children.
He hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loan.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 56-year-old business lady married to Mulondu who is a businessman. They are blessed with five children aged 25, 19, 16, 13 and 9 years old, respectively. She has been in the livestock trading business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy more livestock for selling. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children.
She hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loan.use: To buy more livestock to sell

loan.name: Fanseyni

texts.fr: fanseyni habite dans la rgion du sud au sngal.Age de 49 ans divorce depuis 1995.Elle 4 anfants qui sont tous l'cole et sont aussi a ses charges .Avec ce crdit,elle achate de la marchandise pour augmenter le stock de sa boutique,elle sa journe de 07h 23h. Fanseyni a dmarr son commerce depuis 1995 au moment de sa divorce.Elle a dmarre son commerce avec un petit fonds sur une table pour tre l ou elle est.Avec son commerce,elle assure la nouriture de la famille et les frais scolaire ses enfants. Fanseyni a comme objectif:tre une grande commerante et avoir un grand magasin et sa propre maison dans l'avenir
texts.en: Fanseyni lives in the southern region of Senegal. She is 49 years old and has been divorced since 1995. She has 4 children who live with her and all attend school. With this loan she will buy merchandise to increase the stock in her shop. Her day runs from 7am until 11pm. Fanseyni started her business in 1995 at the time of her divorce. She started her business with a small stock - on a table in order to be close to home. With her business, she is able to feed the family and pay the childrens' school fees. Fanseyni's goal: To be a successful shopkeeper and to have a big shop and her own house in the future.

loan.use: to increase her stock of merchandise

loan.name: Ibraheem

texts.en: Ibraheem, who is a 25-year-old young man, is a father of one son. He is a taxi driver with a low income. He wants to purchase new living room seats to provide comfortable conditions for his family. Ibraheem needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay for the furniture. When he gets the loan, he will be able to purchase new living room seats and this will offer to the family better home conditions. Ibraheem appears in the picture.

loan.use: To purchase new living room seats.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old man from the Western part of Kenya. He is married to Scholastica with whom he has two children.
Peter operates a barber shop and he has been doing this kind of business for the last year.
He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase two more shaving machines. He will use his anticipated profits to plow back into his barber business. He seems qualified for continuous loaning, even in the future.
He desires to open more barber shops within his town.

loan.use: to purchase two more shaving machines

loan.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es: El comit se denomina San Cayetano estn en el septimo Ciclo con 10 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espritu emprendedor, ya que trabajan da a da por conseguir sus objetivos. Una de las miembros es la seora Zulma, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, por medio de su trabajo y gracias a su simpata y buena venta ha podido sacar adelante a su familia con mucho sacrificio. Una de sus metas es tener una tienda grande en la cual pueda tener una buena cantidad de prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundacin y de kiva para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, para poder abastecerse. Agradece esta oportunidad que se le da, pues es muy importante para ella.
texts.en: The committee called San Cayetano is in the seventh cycle with 10 members. It is a group in the neighborhood that is close knit, caring and responsible. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit, working every day to achieve their objectives. One of the members is Mrs. Zulma, who tells us that she sells clothes through her work and thanks to their pleasantness and good sales, has been able to bring up her family with great sacrifice. One of her goals is to have a big store in which to have a good amount of clothing to offer her customers. She enlists the help of the foundation and KIVA to buy clothing of all kinds, to stock up. She is grateful for this opportunity that is it given as it is very important to her.

loan.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy ink and photo paper.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loan.name: Khairulla

texts.en:
Khairulla is a young farmer located in south Kyrgyzstan. He's the only male child in the family, therefore, according to Kyrgyz tradition, he lives with and supports his parents. Their main source of income is animal husbandry. Thanks to Khairulla's dedication and tenacity, his farmstead bring in about 10,000 soms (KGS) per month via the sales of milk and meat products.
In order to increase the herd, Khairulla turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners", requesting a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of three bulls for subsequent fattening and sale.
Khairulla's business plans for the near future consist of investing in his farmstead and increasing his herd, while his personal goals are to get married and raise a family.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more phone accessories.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: buy fertilizers and a spray pump

loan.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty se han unido con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras, actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de la fundacin paraguaya. Estn aprendiendo la importancia de trabajar en equipo dentro de un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicacin. Miguela es una de esas mujeres, comenta que ella trabaja mucho y que le gusta mucho lo que hace, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano. Comenta que le va muy bien, pues en estos tiempos las personas prefieren este tipo de prendas. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de prendas para venderlas otra vez. Ella est agradecida por la oportunidad que le da la fundacin y kiva.
texts.en: Ten women from the city of Curuguaty have teamed up with the goal of working together and thus helping each other. They are currently in the second cycle of the foundation program in Paraguay. They are learning the importance of teamwork within a group with responsibility, honesty and communication. Miguela is one of those women, who says she works hard and likes what she does selling second-hand clothes. She says that she's doing very well, because these days people prefer this type of clothing. She is requesting this credit to purchase clothing to sell again. She is grateful for the opportunity the foundation and KIVA give her.

loan.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loan.name: Javanshir

texts.en: Javanshir is a 47-year-old farmer who lives in a small village in the Imishli region with his wife and three children. He breeds sheep and cattle and has 15 years of experience in this field. During these years, Javanshir has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. He purchases lambs and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. Sheep raising takes about 3-4 months and cattle breeding takes 5-6 months. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profit in the Imishli livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. His business requires a lot of physical strength and Javanshir spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals. Javanshir's monthly income is 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) and Javanshir wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, Javanshir needs more capital to put into his business to cover the market. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. He will use the loan to buy 10 sheep, two cattle and one cow. He has already demonstrated himself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loan.use: to purchase sheep and cattle.

loan.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is a 30-year-old young man, and he is a father to two sons and two daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, and his wife works tailoring clothes and has a low income. Adnan wants to change the old refrigerator at home and purchase a new one to preserve the food the family eats in better and healthy conditions, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay. When Adnan gets the loan, he will be able to purchase a new refrigerator for his home and offer a better standard of living to the family. Adnan is photographed in the picture.

loan.use: to purchase a new home refrigerator.

loan.name: Sayyab

texts.en:
Sayyab is a 57-year-old man who lives and works in the small village in the Imishli region. Sayyab is married and has four children. He owns a small caf where he serves local people national dishes and tea. Tea is the most popular beverage in Azerbaijan and people like to sit for hours and drink tea with homemade jam. He has 10 years of experience in the service business, however he opened his caf just two years ago.
Sayyab`s son helps him to run the business and serve clients. Being polite and friendly helps Sayyab to provide the best quality service to his clients. In the evenings, his caf is full because that is the time when local men join together to chat over a couple kettles of tea.
The monthly profit from Sayyab`s business is 300 AZN. He would like to expand his business, and for this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He will use the loan to make renovations and purchase new chairs, tables, and tableware. This will be his second loan, and he has a good credit history.

loan.use: to make renovations and purchase new chairs, tables, and tableware for his cafe

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase three baby calves

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more, diverse food products and beverages

loan.name: San Jose Group

texts.es: Este grupo es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son 20 mujeres quienes tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y ven una gran ayuda en el programa de la fundacin paraguaya, es por ello que se unieron y de all surge el grupo llamado el progreso, su deseo es poder llegar al mximo nivel del programa y poder crecer no solo en lo econmico, sino tambin en lo social. La sra. Irene es vendedora de Artculos de Limpieza, tiene 3 hijos que van al colegio y tiene su pareja desde hace varios aos, ambos trabajan y ayudan con los gastos de la casa. Comenta que su marido tambin la ayuda en la venta de los productos que vende, y de esa forma es un poco ms ligero el trabajo. Su deseo es extenderse y tener ms clientela y de esa forma tener un mejor ingreso para seguir ayudando a su familia. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de los qumicos que necesita para la elaboracin de los productos de limpieza que vende, como ser: colorantes, esencias, bactericidas, soda caustica y dems insumos necesarios. Agradece a la fundacin por esta oportunidad de progreso que les da a ella y sus compaeras.
texts.en: This group is from the city of Villa Elisa; there are 20 women who are keen to move forward and see a great help in the Paraguayan Foundation program, which is why they joined and then emerged the group called progress. Their desire is to reach the maximum level of the program and to grow not only economically, but also socially. Mrs. Irene is selling cleaning Products, she has 3 children going to school and has a relationship for several years, both work and help with household expenses. She says her husband also helps in selling the products she sells, and thus it is a little lighter work. Her desire is to expand and have more customers and thus have a better income to continue to help her family. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of chemicals needed for the production of cleaning products they sell, such as: colors, scents, bactericides, caustic soda and other necessary inputs. Thanks to the foundation for this opportunity of progress that it gives her and her companions.

loan.use: to purchase chemicals to make homemade cleaning products.

loan.name: Lena Nzasu

texts.en: Lena is 26 years old and is married to a teacher. They have a son and a daughter, aged one and three. Lena is an ambitious woman. She runs a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions and kales. She has been in this business for the last four years. Her business challenge is insufficient funds. She hopes by using this loan of KES 10,000, she will be able to improve her grocery store business. Lena's hope and dream in the next five years is to be a supplier of potatoes and tomatoes in the nearby town.

loan.use: buy potatoes and cabbages

loan.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella vende desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,tambien se dedica a cocinar platos como estofado de pollo,pollo al horno,saltado (es un plato a base de carne frita con papas fritas) entre otros platos,por medio de este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueo de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras al por mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma keeps on engaging in her meals selling activity. She sells breakfast, lunch and dinner meals, and she also cooks dishes such as chicken stew, baked chicken, strip steak (fried meat with french fries) and more. Thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her children. Her dream is to expand and improve her meals selling activity. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetable at wholesale price.
She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loan.use: To buy ingredients for her cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetable at wholesale price.

loan.name: Miguela

texts.es: La Sra. Miguela es de la ciudad de Caacup, es separada, tiene hijos, pero todos ya mayores. Ella se dedica a la fabricacin y venta de chipas (alimento tpico paraguayo) desde hace mas de 20 aos, comenta que gracias a este trabajo pudo darle todo lo que necesitaba su familia. Siempre fue una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y pese a los aos que ya lleva en el negocio, siempre disfruta de lo que hace. Desea seguir trabajando y creciendo, por lo que siempre se esfuerza al mximo por eso. solicita a la fundacin y Kiva un crdito para la compra de materia prima para chipa en cantidades,como ser almidn, manteca, huevos, condimentos y dems, y as obtiene mejores precios y le sobra ms ganancias de su productos.
texts.en: Miguela comes from the town of Caacup. She is separated from her husband and she has adult children. She has been engaged in preparing chipas (a typical Paraguayan food) for more than 20 years, and she says that thanks to this activity she has been able to provide for her family giving them all they needed. She has always been a very hard-working and resourceful woman, and in spite of the years she has dedicated to her activity, she always enjoys what she does. She wants to keep on working and improving, and for this reason she always seriously engages in it. She is requesting a loan to the institution and to Kiva to buy big quantities of basic ingredients for the chipas such as starch, butter, eggs, flavorings among others: this way she will sell at better prices and she will earn more from the selling of her products.

loan.use: To buy starch, butter, eggs, flavorings and other ingredients to prepare "chipas".

loan.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El socio Ronald se sigue al negocio de venta de ceviche,el tiene locales donde vende ceviche,el socio atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueo del socio es ampliar y mejorar los locales donde vende ceviche.El socio solicita el credito para comprar insumos para el ceviche como pescado,limon,camote y lechuga al por mayor.
El socio est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ronald keeps on selling (marinated seafood cocktails). He sells ceviche in leased locales. He works form 8 am to 6 pm, and thanks to this activity he is able to provide for his children. He dreams of expanding and improving the locales where he sells ceviche. He is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for ceviche such as fish, lemon, sweet potato and lettuce at wholesale price.
He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loan.use: To buy fish, lemon, sweet potato and lettuce at wholesale price to prepare ceviche.

loan.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is 31 years old market vendor. He is single and lives with his parents. He sells detergents products for last 6 years. Emin is very polite and friendly person and thats why his sales is increasing every months. His father helps him to sell products. His shop is in the central bazaar, the most popular vending place, always full of customers.
The income business brings 230 AZN per month. Emin would like to increase his income via purchasing more merchandise and increase his sales. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. This will be his 3rd loan and he has a good credit history.

loan.use: purchase more merchandise

loan.name: Xuan

texts.en: Ms Xuan is the mother of Minh, who is a student. Minh was born in 1993. She is studying accounting at the University. Her study duration lasts 36 months. She is a first year student. To be an accountant is her dream job, and she is trying to study hard to absorb knowledge since she wants to be self-confident in her new career. She hopes she will get a good job after graduation. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnamese Dongs to pay for tuition fees.

loan.use: pay tuition fees

loan.name: Pethis

texts.en:
Pethis is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with four children between 4 and 7 years old; they are in school and live at home.
Pethis has been involved in the used clothes business for the past two years. She says her main challenge is a transportation problem. She started this business with money received from her friend. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit and makes her popular.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future, she wants to achieve higher education and lift her living standards.

loan.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loan.name: Tecoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es: 14 mujeres de la ciudad de Asuncin, se han unido con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Este grupo se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo, todas las mujeres son trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy sacrificadas. una de las miembros es la seora Patricia, quien nos comenta que se dedica al reciclaje, este es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que ella tiene que recorrer por las cales buscando productos que sean reciclables. Ella est muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto y gracias a esto puede dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de materiales reciclables en cantidad, para que de esa forma revenda y tenga un poco ms de ganancias. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se les da.
texts.en: Fourteen women from the city of Asuncion have joined with the goal of helping each other by working together. This group is in the fourth cycle; all women are working, struggling and living hard lives. One of the members is Mrs. Patricia, who tells us that she sells recycling, this is very hard work, and she has to go traveling the streets looking for products that are recyclable. She is very proud of what she does, it is a decent and honest job and because of this she can give her family everything they need. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of recyclable materials in quantity, to resell and have a little more profit. She is thankful for the opportunity given to them.

loan.use: to purchase recyclable materials for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy clothes

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy pigs.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy shoes

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: buy more food to sell in her food stall

loan.name: Vera Cristina

texts.es: Vera Cristina es una seora de 50 aos de edad, que trabajo como asalariada durante 18 aos como empleada comercial ; hace dos aos se le presenta la oportunidad de convertirse en emprendedora cuando la duea de la tienda donde ha laborado tantos aos, decide dejar la actividad del comercio y pone a la venta el derecho comercial, Vera Cristina sigue todavia como empleada mientas aparece alguien interesada en adquirirla, un da que se encontraba limpiando los muebles del negocio le pide a Dios, que si este negocio es para ella, le ponga a la persona que pueda apoyarla financieramente para tener el capital inicial y comenzar ya ella como duea, aparece esta persona y le ofrece prestarle $ 1,000.00 y alli comienza una actividad comercial sobre la que se tenia experiencia ya que la habia administrado durante tantos aos. Se da cuenta que existe Fundacin Mujer, y decide tramitar un prstamo para capital de trabajo, esto le permite generar mas ventas y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida; es as como recurre nuevamente a Fundacin Mujer solicitando apoyo financiero, para reforzar su capital de trabajo, con la compra de mas mercaderia(camisetas,jeans y camisas) y aprovechar la epoca de las fiestas navideas y de fin de ao, y ofrecer una mayor variedad de los articulos que ella comercializa. El deseo de Vera Cristina es tener los recursos a futuro, que le permitan poder tener una casa propia ya que en este momento la comparte con su hijo, y es conciente que este tiene el derecho de hacer su vida tambien.
texts.en: Vera Cristina is a 50-year-old woman who worked for 18 years as a salaried employee. Two years ago the opportunity arose for her to become a businesswoman when the owner of the store where she worked for so many years decided to give up the activity and put the business up for sale. Vera Christina continued working as an employee while it appeared someone was interested in buying the business. One day while she was cleaning the store's furniture, she asked God if the business was for her. She found a person who could support her financially with the initial capital so she could become the owner. This person offered to loan her the money, and she took over the business she already knew how to administer from her years of experience. She became aware of Kiva partner Fundacin Mujer and decided to apply for a loan to give her more working capital so she could generate more sales and in turn improve her quality of life. She turns once again to Fundacin Mujer, requesting financial support to strengthen her cash flow so she can purchase more merchandise (shirts, T-shirts, jeans) and take advantage of Christmas time and New Year's by offering a wider variety of products. Her dream is to have the resources in the future to be able to have her own home since she currently shares one with her son and she knows he has the right to live his own life, too.

loan.use: to purchase shirts, T-shirts and jeans.

loan.name: Mario

texts.es: El seor Mario tiene 55 aos de edad, vive con la seora Amelia de 54 aos de edad, viven en la ciudad de It, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo la menor vive con ellos, los dems ya son todos independientes. El seor Mario tiene una despensa en su domicilio hace mas de 10 aos, all surte a vecinos y a ocasionales con todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar tales como, azcar, yerba, lcteos, bebidas en gral., carbn y otros productos. Comenta que su esposa le ayuda en el negocio. El quiere seguir creciendo para poder continuar manteniendo su casa. El solicita el crdito para la compra de azcar, yerba, carbn, bebidas en gral. y otros insumos con lo cual podr abastecer su negocio y tener ms variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mario is 55 years old, he lives with Amelia, aged 54, in the town of It and they have 5 children: only the youngest daughter lives with them, while the other children are all economically independent. Mario has been running a small store in his house for more than 10 years, where he sells every kind of basic necessities for the house such as sugar, yerba mat, dairy products, drinks, carbon and so on to his neighbors and to occasional customers. He says that his wife helps him in the shop. He wants to keep on growing in order to keep on providing for this family. He is requesting a loan to buy sugar, yerba mat, carbon, drinks and other products to supply his shop and to have a wider variety of products to offer to his customers.

loan.use: To buy sugar, yerba mat, carbon, drinks and other products.

loan.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis, tiene 40 aos, esta casado con la Sra. Sonia hace 19 aos, tienen 3 hijos todos ellos varones, Walter, Juan y Jorge, los tres chicos se encuentran estudiando. El Sr. Luis anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leche y tena una carnicera, luego comenz a interesarse por la Veterinaria y empez a estudiar hasta que se recibi de Dr. Veterinario, desde esa vez, hace 4 aos que posee su Agro-Veterinaria donde trabaja en compaa de su esposa, actualmente posee su local en su domicilio. Gracias a la buena atencin que brinda ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre acude a el. Solicita la ayuda de la fundacin y de kiva para comprar vitaminas, vacunas, alimentos para animales, etc. lo cual el vende en su agroveterinaria. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da, pues el crdito le ser de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Luis is 40 years old and has been married to Sonia for 19 years. They have three sons who are in school, Walter, Juan and Jorge. Luis previously made a living selling milk and had a butcher shop. He started to become interested in veterinary medicine and started studying until he received his doctorate. Since that time he has had his veterinary office for about four years and works alongside his wife. He currently runs his office out of his home. Thanks to the good service he provides he already has a good customer base that always comes to him. He is requesting the help of Kiva and partner Fundacin Paraguaya to help him purchase vitamins, vaccines, animal feed and other items to sell at his veterinary office. He is grateful for this opportunity because the loan will be a big help.

loan.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines, animal feed, etc.

loan.name: Nelida

texts.es: La Seora Nlida es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 51 aos de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia. Nos cuenta que tiene un taller de Corte y Confeccin donde realiza trabajos de alta costura como trajecitos, Vestidos, Camisas y otros. Comenta que el taller que tiene lo heredo de su mam y que gracias al esfuerzo que ella le pone ha podido crecer y hacerse de una clientela considerable. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien no le teme a ningn desafo ni trabajo, y lo ha demostrado levantando en negocio que tiene. Solicita el crdito para la compra de telas, gomas y botones, los cuales son indispensables para ella, ya que son los insumos que utiliza en su taller. Est mu agradecida por la ayuda que le dan kiva y fundacin paraguaya.
texts.en: Nlida is from the city of Villarrica, Paraguay. She is 51 years old, married and lives in her own home. She says that she has a sewing shop where she does haute couture like suits, dresses, shirts and other items. She says that she inherited the shop from her mother, and thanks to her hard work she has been able to grow it and have a considerable customer base. She defines herself as a hard-working and enterprising woman who isn't afraid of any challenge or task, and she has demonstrated that with her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics, rubber and buttons, which are indispensable items for her workshop. She is very grateful for the support from Kiva and Fundacin Paraguaya.

loan.use: to purchase fabric, rubber and buttons.

loan.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 49 aos de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 23, 21, 19, 17, 15 y 11 aos de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolvar.
La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad, se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantn San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz, trigo, cebada y papas como fuente de ingresos de la familia. Las compras lo hace en San Miguel y las ventas lo hace a cualquier comerciante.
Solicita el crdito para la agricultura y comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, urea, lquidos. Con la ayuda del crdito ha podido comprar los abonos sin ningn problema.
El sueo es poder comprar terrenos para sembrar y tener una casa para poder vivir con la familia. Los desafos a los que se ha enfrentado es en las temporadas de ao que existe variedad del clima y esto produce la lancha a los cultivos y por eso se daan. En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del Divino Nio.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children. He lives with his wife and his children ages 23, 21, 19, 17, 15 and 11 in the province of San Miguel de Bolvar.
The VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico, having the name of the community, is found 20 minutes from the canton of San Miguel and they work in agriculture as the source of family income.
Jorge works in agriculture, planting corn, wheat, barley, and potatos as the source of income for his family. He makes his purchases in San Miguel and his sales in various markets.
He is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, urea, and solutions for agriculture. With the aid of the loan, he has been able to purchase the compost without any problems.
His dream is to be able to purchase fields to plant and to have a house so he can live with his family.
The challenges that he has faced come in the seasons of the year when the weather varies and this produces the late blight, thus damaging the crops.
In his free time, he enjoys the festivals of the Divine Child.

loan.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, urea, and other solutions used for farming.

loan.name: Gloria Rosmira

texts.es: La seora Gloria trabaj por varios aos en una empresa, la cual hace poco fue liquidada y con este acontecimiento la seora Gloria quedo sin empleo, por esta razn, tomo clases de encuadernacin y gracias a su hermana quien le consigui clientes pudo iniciar su actividad desde su casa de encuadernacin de libros, trabajos escritos y fotocopias. Con esta labor, puede generar los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades bsicas de ella y sus dos hijos de 17 y 14 aos de edad, con el nimo de cumplir varios pedidos que tiene, la seora Gloria necesita de la compra de materia prima tal como argollado, pastas de proteccin para libros y moldes y una estantera para acomodar su trabajo. El sueo de la seora Gloria es tener su propio local y brindarle una buena educacin a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria worked for many years at a business, which closed not long ago. She has been unemployed since. She took bookbinding classes and started a business from home, offering book and manuscript binding and photocopying services. Her sister helps her get new customers. The income from this business is enough to support Gloria and her two children, ages 17 and 14.
In order to complete several orders, Gloria needs supplies such as spiral binding, laminated covers and a bookshelf to organize her work. Gloria's dream is to have a separate store location for her business and to be able to provide her children with a good education.

loan.use: To buy bookbinding supplies and a bookshelf.

loan.name: Nelson Jesus

texts.es:
Nelson Jess tiene 60 aos de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y la hija de 23 aos de edad en Ventanas Provincia de Bolvar.
La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad, se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantn San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
Nelson se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura coMo fuente de ingresos de la familia lo que ms siembra es maz, trigo y papas.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en san Miguel . Solicita el crdito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes y pago a los trabajadores. Con la ayudadel crdito ha podido comprar los productos y abonos agrcolas.
El sueo es poder tener la oportunidad de comprar terrenos. Los desafos a los que se ha enfrentado es los vientos y las lanchas en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boley.
texts.en:
Nelson Jsus is 60 years old and married with one daughter. He lives with his wife and twenty-three year-old daughter in Ventanas in the Province of Bolvar.
The VRC [Ventanillas Rurales Crdito, or Window to the Countryside Loan] is called Yagui Chico, after the community which is twenty minutes from the Canton of San Miguel, and whose members work in agriculture to provide their families with a source of income.
Nelson works as a farmer to provide his family with a source of income. He mostly cultivates corn, wheat, and potatoes.
His purchases and sales occur mostly in San Miguel. He is requesting the loan to purchase manure, fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs. With the help of the loan he has been able to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.
His dream is to be able to have the opportunity to purchase land. The challenges he faces are the winds and frost in his crops.
In his free time he likes to play sports, especially volleyball.

loan.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs.

loan.name: Carmelo

texts.es: El Seor Carmelo tiene 28 aos de edad, esta casado con la Sra Demetria, ellos tienen 1 hijo. El es dueo de una Despensa, su local se encuentra ubicado cerca de una cancha lo que le ayuda a tener buena clientela porque es un lugar muy concurrido especialmente por deportistas que despus de jugar se van a comprar bebidas. Comenta que su esposa siempre lo ayuda en el negocio, ella se encarga de preparar empanadas, milanesas y sndwiches que se venden en la despensa. El sueo que tienen es agrandar su negocio y de esa forma tener un poco ms de ganancias para poder, de esa forma, garantizarle un mejor futuro a su hijo, el cual es el motivo de lucha de ellos. Acude a la Fundacin para la compra de bebidas como vinos finos, sidras, gaseosas, golosinas y cervezas, de esa forma va a poder seguir ofreciendo a su clientela productos variados y a buen precio, de esa forma seguir mejorando su nivel de vida y de su familia.
texts.en: Carmelo is twenty-eight years old and is married to Demetria. They have one child. He owns a grocery store that is located near a ball field, which helps him have many customers since athletes usually frequent his store to purchase drinks after playing sports. He says that his wife always helps him with his business. She prepares empanadas, milanesas [schnitzel-style breaded fried meat], and sandwiches which they sell in the store. Their dream is to increase their business, and in this way earn more profits so as to be able to guarantee their son a better future. This is what motivates their efforts. He has turned to the Fundacin to purchase drinks such as dry wines, cider, soda pop, sweets, and beer. In this way he will be able to continue offering his customers a variety of products at a fair price, which will allow him to continue improving his and his familys quality of life.

loan.use: To purchase drinks to sell in his grocery store.

loan.name: Janet Kaniki

texts.en: Janet, 31 years old, is a single woman. She has no children yet. For the past one year, she has been selling mobile phones, phone accessories, and providing phone charging services. In addition, she is employed as a Safaricom agent. Sometimes in her business she faces a challenge of delayed operation from the Safaricom company when doing money transactions. She will use the loan KES 20,000 to purchase phone accessories. Janet's hopes and dreams is to run several similar stores in the next five years.

loan.use: buy phone accessories

loan.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es:
ngel Miguel tiene 53 aos de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 29, 23, 21, 19 y 13 aos de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolvar.
La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad, se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantn San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
ngel se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura para mantener a mi familia lo que ms produce es el maz y el trigo.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel y el choclo en la comunidad.
Solicita el crdito para la agricultura y comprar semillas, abonos, urea, lquidos para la maleza.
Con la ayuda del crdito ha podido comprar lo necesario para poder sembrar como las semillas, abonos agrcolas. El sueo es poder comprar terreno y que los hijos culminen los estudios y sean profesionales. El desafo que se le ha presentado es la lancha y los fuertes vientos que daan el cultivo de maz. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo con la familia las festividades del Divino Nio.
texts.en:
ngel Miguel is 53 years old, married with five children, and lives with his wife and children in San Miguel in the Province of Bolvar. His children are twenty-nine, twenty-three, twenty-one, nineteen, and thirteen years old.
The VRC [Ventanillas Rurales Crdito, or Window to the Countryside Loan] is called Yagui Chico, after the community which is twenty minutes from the Canton of San Miguel, and whose members work in agriculture to provide their families with a source of income.
ngel works as a farmer to provide for his family. He grows mostly corn and wheat.
His purchases and sales occur mostly in San Miguel, while he raises the corn in his community.
He is requesting the loan for agricultural purposes to purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea [a nitrogen-rich additive], and liquid herbicides.
With the help of the loan, he has been able to purchase the seeds and fertilizers necessary to be able to plant his crops. His dream is to be able to purchase land, and that his children complete their studies and have professions. The frost and strong winds that damage his corn crops are the challenges he faces. In his free time he likes to take walks with his family during the Christmas festivities.

loan.use: for agricultural purposes to purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea [a nitrogen-rich additive], and liquid herbicides.

loan.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 51 aos de edad es casada no tiene hijos, vive con el esposo en san Miguel provincia de Bolvar. La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad, se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantn San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
Luz se dedica a los trabajos del campo y a los quehaceres de la casa, lo que ms siembra es maz, habas, `para vender y tambin en poca cantidad para consumo de la casa.
Las compras y las ventas de los productos los hace en San Miguel.
Solicita el crdito para poder invertir en la agricultura en las compras de semillas, fertilizantes, lquidos para la maleza y para poder invertir en los estudios de los hijos.
Con la ayuda del crdito podr comprar las semillas y abonos agrcolas sin ningn tipo xde problema. El sueo es poder comprar terrenos para poder sembrar y no estar pagando arriendo.
El desafo que se le ha presentado es la sequedad la falta de agua para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta celebrar las fiestas del divino nio.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 51, is married and has no children. She lives with her husband in San Miguel in the province of Bolvar. Her communal bank is called "Yagui Chico" which is the name of her community. It is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton and agriculture is the source of income for the family.
Luz works in the field and takes care of the household. She grows corn and lima beans to sell and to use for home consumption. She buys and sells in San Miguel.
She is requesting a loan to invest in her agriculture business and plans to buy seeds, fertilizer and weed killer so she can pay for her childrens' education.
The loan will allow her to buy seeds and fertilizer without any problem. Her dream is to buy cropland so she does not have to rent land. Her greatest challenge is lack of water for the crops due to drought.
In her free time she enjoys celebrating the "Fiestas del Divino Nio" (Divine Child Festivities).

loan.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and weed killer.

loan.name: Efrain Leonardo

texts.es:
Efran Leonardo tiene 41 aos de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 17, 10,8,6 aos de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolvar.
La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad, se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantn San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
Efrain se dedica a los trabajos en la agricultura para mantener a la familia lo que ms siembra es el maz, trigo y cebada.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. Solicita el crdito para invertir en la agricultura y comprar de abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas y pago de peones.
Con la ayuda del crdito pudo comprar lo necesario para la siembra del maz los abonos, y los lquidos. El seo es poder construir una casa no importa que sea pequea pero en san Miguel
El desafos que se le ha presentado son los vientos y la falta de agua.
En el tiempo libre que es el domingo le gusta jugar el boly y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y Divino Nio.
texts.en:
Efran Leonardo, 41, is married and has four children. He lives with his wife and children, ages 17, 10, 8 and 6 in San Miguel in the province of Bolvar.
His communal bank is called "Yagui Chico" after the name of the community which is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton. Agriculture is the source of income for the family.
Efran works in agriculture to support his family and his main crops are corn, wheat and barley. He buys and sells in San Miguel. He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, urea, and insecticides and to hire workers. The loan will allow him to buy all he needs for his corn crop, such as fertilizer and other liquids.
His dream is to build a house in San Miguel, even if it is a small one.
The challenges he is up against are winds and drought.
In his free time he enjoys playing volleyball on Sundays and he also likes the "Divino Nio" festivities and carnival.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer, urea, insecticides and to hire workers.

loan.name: Alvaro Marcelo

texts.es:
Alvaro Marcelo tiene 21 aos de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive solo en san Miguel Provincia de Bolvar.
La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad, se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantn San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
lvaro se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura como fuente de ingresos lo que ms produce es el maz.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. Solicita el crdito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas, lquidos para la maleza y poder culminar los estudios.
El sueo es poder culminar los estudios y llegar hacer profesional para poder trabajar.
No se le ha presentado ningn tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Alvaro Marcelo is 21, single and has no children. He lives alone in San Miguel in the province of Bolvar.
His communal bank "Yagui Chico" is named after the community which is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton and the members have agriculture as their source of income for the families.
Alvaro earns a living through agriculture and grows corn mainly. He buys and sells in San Miguel. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, seeds, insecticides and weed killer, as well as to finish his education. His dream is to finish his studies and become a professional so he can get a job.
He has not had any problem of any kind. In his free time he enjoys going out and being active in sports.

loan.use: To buy supplies, fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and weed killer, and to finish his education.

loan.name: Libia Omaira

texts.es: La seora Libia es propietaria de una pequea tienda adecuada en la sala de su casa y con la cual inicio hace 8 aos con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y estar al lado de su hijo. Esta tienda le brinda a la seora Libia los ingresos mnimos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y as la calidad de vida de su hijo, la seora Libia necesita de la compra de surtido de licor y abarrotes para mejorar los productos ofrecidos y el servicio a sus clientes. El sueo de la seora Libia es ampliar su negocio y brindarle a su hijo lo mejor en educacin, vivienda y salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Libia owns a small store that she runs out of her living room. She started the business in an effort to improve her income while taking care of her son. The store gives Libia the minimum resources necessary to maintain the household.
In an effort to increase sales and improve her son's lifestyle, Libia needs to buy a variety of liquors and groceries to improve her product range and customer service. Her dream is to expand business and giver her son a better education, environment and wellness.

loan.use: To buy a variety of liquors and groceries.

loan.name: Lydia Susan

texts.en: Lydia, 32 years old, is married and has a two-year-old son. She describes herself as a visionary woman. She runs a retail store and sells detergents, cooking fat, sugar, rice, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Lydia faces a challenge of insufficient funds for expanding her business. She will be using the loan KES 20,000 to buy two bags of rice, one bag of sugar, and five cartons of cooking fat. Her hopes and dreams for the next five years is to run a supermarket.

loan.use: buy rice, sugar and cooking fat

loan.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es:
Manuel Francisco tiene 31 aos de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 5 y 9 aos de edad en San Miguel provincia de Bolvar.
La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad, se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantn San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
Manuel se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia lo que ms siembra es el maz.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. Solicita el crdito para trabajar en el campo y poder comprar los abonos agrcolas, fertilizantes, lquidos, urea y las semillas.
Con la ayuda del crdito podr comprar los abonos sin ningn tipo de problema. No se le ha presentado ningn tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Manuel Francisco, 31, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children, ages 5 and 9, in San Miguel in the province of Bolvar.
His communal bank is called "Yagui Chico" after the community it is in which is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton. Here most people are involved in agriculture as a source of income for their families.
Manuel grows crops for a living with corn being his main crop. He buys and sells in San Miguel. He is requesting a loan to work in the fields and buy fertilizers, liquids, urea and seeds.
The loan will allow him to buy the fertilizers without any problem. He has had no difficulties so far. In his free time he enjoys playing volleyball.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers, liquids, urea and seeds.

loan.name: Fausena

texts.en: On the table seen above, Fausena has some watermelons displayed on it. She sells different kinds of fruits at Ayensudu near Elmina. She is married and has 3 children. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loan.use: buy fruits to sell

loan.name: Osse-Ni Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OSSE-NI est form de trois personnes qui vivent dans le mme quartier. La reprsentante de ce groupe, nomme Assatou, est celle dont la main est leve sur la photo. Cest la premire fois que ce groupe sollicite lappui financier de ALID en vue dlever le niveau de leur activit. Assatou est ge de 33 ans et est marie un revendeur du nom de Gafari. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolariss et leur charge. Assatou n'a pas frquent l'cole. Il y a trois ans, Assatou mne comme activit la vente de pices dtaches dans une ville du Bnin. Assatou achte ses produits au Bnin. Dans le but daugmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux rpondre la demande de sa clientle, Assatou sollicite pour la premire fois un crdit auprs de ALID, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OSSE-NI.
texts.en: The OSSE-NI group is made up of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, called Assatou, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time the group are seeking financial assistance from ALID, in order to increase the scale of their business. Assatou is 33 years old and is married to a retailer called Gafari. They have three children, all living at home and in school. Assatou did not go to school. For the last three years, Assatou has carried out the trade of selling spare parts in a city in Benin. Assatou buys her products in Benin. With a view to increasing her stock of products, and better meeting the needs of her customers, Assatou is seeking a loan from ALID for the first time, together with the other members of the OSSE-NI group.

loan.use: to buy spare parts

loan.name: Ama Gladys

texts.en: Ama Gladys operates a chop bar (a place where a variety of African food is sold) at Ayensudo near Elmina. In the picture above, she is pounding fufu. She cooks food like banku, fufu, rice bolls and other dishes. She is married and has three children. She wants to expand her business. This loan from Kiva will be invested into her cooking business for further expansion.

loan.use: invest in her food business

loan.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es:
Luis Bernardo tiene 25 aos vive en casado, vive con la esposa y un hijo, de un ao. Vive en el Recinto San Temistocles en el Cantn Ventanas.
La ventanilla NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al cantn Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrcolas de ciclo corto siembre de maz y arroz.
Luis Bernardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz desde hace tres aos. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crdito solicita para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maz. El prstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueo es comprar un terreno y ayudar al hijo en el estudio.
Le gusta hacer deporte con el hijo y con los vecinos del barrio.
texts.en:
Luis Bernardo is 25 years old and married. He lives with his wife and one-year-old son in the San Temistocles precinct of the Ventanas canton.
The communal bank Narcisa de Jesus," or Daffodil of Jesus is located in the San Temistocles precint, belonging to the Vantanas canton. This communal bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.
Luis Bernardo is a farmer and has been growing corn for three years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and then sells his goods at a market in the same area.
Luis Bernardo is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for sowing corn. The loan has helped him increase his income, which goes towards his familys consumptions and towards investment. His dream is to purchase a plot of land and help his son get an education.
He likes to play sports with his son and people from the neighborhood.

loan.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer to sow corn

loan.name: Ela Carmela

texts.es:
Ela es una mujer de 27, soltera, que se dedica a la preparacin y venta de tortas, bocaditos, entre otros, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace ms de 8 aos, junto a su madre y a su hermana, a travs del tiempo ha demostrado mucho inters en continuar mejorando el servicio en su trabajo, es por ello que actualmente tambin realiza decoraciones en los eventos donde vende sus tortas. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacin ella puede llegar a ganar hasta S/.64 diarios, lo que le permite cubrir todos los gastos que debe afrontar mensualmente, como la preparacin de las tortas y gastos personales.
Ella se dedica tambin a atender la bodega de su madre junto a su hermana, lo que les permite un ingreso extra a ambas. Un recuerdo que tengo es cuando prepare junto a mi hermana una torta de 3 pisos, cubierta de masa elstica, y por accidente se nos cay, tuvimos que arreglarla en ese momento, afortunadamente todo sali bien comenta Ela entre risas.
Gracias a los prestatarios Kiva Ela podr tener mayor cantidad de dinero, lo que la ayudar a poder comprar algunos materiales que le son necesarios. Con esfuerzo y dedicacin ella llegar a su meta, brindar el servicio de alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles y una mejor decoracin donde venda sus tortas y bocaditos, lo que le permitir tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ela is a single woman who is 27 years of age. She has been preparing and selling cakes, snacks, and other foods for more than eight years alongside her mother and sister. Over time, Ela has demonstrated great interest in improving the service she provides in her business. For this reason, she currently makes decorations for events in addition to selling cakes. Thanks to her effort and dedication, Ela has been able to earn 64 PEN each day, which enables her to cover her monthly expenses. This includes preparing cakes and her personal expenses.

Ela also manages a grocery store with her mother and sister, which enables them to earn extra income. One memory I have is when my sister and I prepared a cake with three layers and covered it with icing. The cake fell down by accident and we had to repair it at that moment. Fortunately, everything ended well, recalls Ela with a laugh.

Thanks to the Kiva lenders, Ela will be able to access more money to help her buy some necessary supplies. As a result of her effort and dedication, she will be able to reach her goal. Ela will provide rental services that offer tables, chairs, tablecloths, and major decorations from the same shop where she sells cakes and snacks. This will enable her have a better quality of life.

loan.use: to buy baking and decorating supplies.

loan.name: Etienne

texts.en: Etienne is married with seven children. He is 45 years old. All of his children attend school. He sells spare parts for bicycles. He has been running this business for the period of one and a half years selling the bicycle spare parts but in addition for the time he started the business of both motorcycle and bicycles is now about five years. He requested the loan to add more spare parts to sell. He plans to use the profits to expand his business building. In the future, he wishes to sell more spare parts.

loan.use: To buy more spare parts for sell.

loan.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 22 years old. She is married, with 4 children. She sells different items in her store for which she has been running for the period of 3 years. All profits go to schooling her children. She wants the loan to add more merchandise like rice, sugar and cooking oil. She expects to use the profits from this business to set up a wholesale shop to supply the small business people. In the future, she expects to be the major supplier.
